loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Banteay Meanchey province, Meng is 24 years old and a father of two young children. He grows rice as his main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement the family’s income. He has been involved in this business for ages and he can earn about 28,900 KHR per day.

This is the second cycle for Meng with VisionFund; he fully repaid his past loan. He now leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his rice farm. He hopes that he can earn more income from his business so as to fulfill his dream of running a new business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: Rubelyn is from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Rubelyn is 32 years old and married with four children. She has been planting and harvesting rice with her husband as a farmer to make a living. She also earns additional income from raising pigs for sale. Rubelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. With her income generated from her farm, she was able to support the needs of her children. Recently, she took a new loan to pay for fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs. She wants to have a better living in the near future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food. She sells chips, chapatti and fried cassava at the market on a retail basis. 

She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling charcoal. She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO of UGX 1,300,000 to buy a jerrycan of cooking oil, a tray of eggs, a bag of cassava, cabbages, irish potatoes and baking flour for her business.

Her major challenges include high taxes that are charged by the revenue authority. Her major expenses includes rent and feeding the family. She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy a jerrycan of cooking oil, eggs, cassava ,cabbages and baking flour for her business.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 26 años de edad, logró estudiar contaduría en la ciudad, pues un amigo suyo le ofreció asilo en el cual pudiera permanecer durante estudiara, ahora está soltero y aún no tiene hijos.


Él trabaja como administrador de fondos de una ruta de transportes, tiene cuatro años de estar ejerciendo este cargo, anteriormente trabajó como contador en una librería. La distancia que recorre para llegar a su actual trabajo es de un kilómetro y se va a pie, y trabaja 8 horas diarias.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar la casa de sus padres, comprará cemento, arena y pagará mano de obra.

Espera seguir estudiando,  también formar una familia, desea seguir apoyando a sus padres e ir ahorrando poco a poco para realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 26. He was able to study accounting in the city, because a friend offered him a place to stay during his studies. He is currently single with no children.
He works as an account administrator for a transportation company. He has been doing this for four years and previously worked as an accountant at a bookstore. He travels one kilometre by foot to get to work, and works 8 hours per day.
He needs a loan in order to improve his parents' home. He will purchase cement and sand, and pay the labourers.
He hopes to continue studying and start a family as well. He wants to continue supporting his parents and to save up bit by bit in order to reach his dreams,

loans.use: to improve his parents' home. He will buy cement and sand, and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler to hold the soft drinks she sells

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson, 56 years old, is married with 4 children. He has been working on their own farm for many years withhis wife to make a living.

He needs financially to cover planting materials and weeding maintenance costs in order to improve his farm. Now he would like to borrow a loan from Gata Daku MPC  to cover planting materials and weeding maintenance costs for his rice growing farm. 

Nelson hopes to increase his harvest so that he can take care of his family’s daily needs and purchase additional farmland aswell.

loans.use: to cover planting materials and weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is aged 33 years and married, with two daughters and one son who are dependent on her. To support the family, she sells vegetables, and is also a paid worker. She has been in this business for five years. 

Chreb is in her third cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more vegetables for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Medi

texts.en:
Medi is a charcoal seller from Makenke, Mbarara district. He is 28 years and happily married, with two children. He did not go far in his education because the family failed to raise money for high school and as a result he dropped out of school.

After dropping out of school, he immediately started buying and selling avocado fruits in markets and on the streets. He struggled with the business, as it was not profitable, before learning about the charcoal business. He began by buying a sack of charcoal and selling it tins. Realizing that the business was profitable, he sought to expand the business to compete favorably. He came to UGAFODE and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 UGX, which he paid very well. 

Just recently, his elder brother died and left him with the responsibility of caring for the bereaved family. He again approached us, requesting 2,000,000 UGX to help him further expand the business so as to realize more profits to cater for the family, which has grown in size. Assistance rendered to him is highly appreciated.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is hardworking. He has been in the cattle trade since 1990- a business he opted for because he had experience and it was not time consuming. He has time to look after his farm and family as well. However, he has challenges with the cash flow because of the children in high school who are taking much of the money. He opted to come to UGAFODE because the terms of payment were friendly. He will sure repay the loan when his cattle have fattened and are sold. He thanks UGAFODE for the flexibility and good service.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Merge

texts.en:
Merge is a widow with seven children. She was driven to cattle fattening and trade out of the need to provide for her children.She is requesting a loan to buy cows for fattening. She is assured of market for the cows

She thanks UGAFODE for the good services that she had failed to get elsewhere. The fact that she can pay quarterly gives her the chance to meet all her other financial obligations as well as pay the loan when the time comes. She is hard working and thanks the Kiva lenders for allowing to partner with her.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is a local villager in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is aged 28 years old and is a married mother of two children. She is a farmer who has been growing rice and sesame for seven years. The current business earns her about 68,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs.
 
This is Sokhoeurn's third loan cycle with VisionFund (the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle). Now she is leading a group of two to request a new loan. As the leader, Sokhoeurn will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get more crops from her rice as well as her sesame farming so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: La Group

texts.en:
La, 49, is a farmer living in Kampong Speu province, and she is a mother of five children, two of whom are in school. To struggle a living, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland as her main source of income. Moreover, she sells grocery items to supplement the income. 

This is fourth cycle for La with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. She is now leading her group to seek a loan. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can make her family live in a healthy way.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Yufi

texts.en:
Mrs Yufi is selling water filters in Jakarta. Jakarta is an enormous city of over 14 million inhabitants. Most of them have no access to piped drinking water and get their water from wells. Because there are no sewers in Jakarta and no waste water treatment, ground water is highly contaminated. Boiling it for less then 3 minutes will not kill all the bugs in it.

So getting safe drinking water is a hassle in Jakarta even though the burning heat makes that you need to drink at least 3 liters a day. For that reason Yufi is selling Nazava drinking water filters that remove bacteria from well, rain and tap water. After being filtered by a Nazava water filter, you can drink the water without boiling it first. 

Yufi sells through a network of 5 sales agents that sell the filters through direct marketing methods. With this loan the filters can be sold in installment which makes them more accessible to the poor. Using this loan Yufi can provide safe drinking water to more then 2000 people.

loans.use: to help inhabitants of Jakarta get safe drinking water

loans.name: Nath's Group

texts.en:
Nath is 32 years old and she lives in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of three children. She has been farming rice for twelve years, and to supplement the family’s income she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Nath has been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans have helped improve her living conditions. Now she is leading a group of four to ask for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get a higher yield from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Pursat province, Sor is a mother of two children and both of them are in school. To support her family’s condition, she cultivates paddy rice as the main source of income and also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is first time for Sor with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan.  Sor will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes that she can improve her family’s condition to better than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Khov's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Khov is 30 years old and has three children. She grows rice while her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her about 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

Khov is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, las cuales trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos en el hogar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, etc. para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Berta is 65 years old. She lives in her own house with her three daughters, who work and help her with household expenses. For the past several years, she has had a small store that is located in the place where she lives. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy soups, eggs, snacks, soft drinks, basic grains, etc. in order to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, snacks, soft drinks, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Esmeralda, tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y ofrece queso fresco; vive con su esposo y tres hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando, su negocio nace por la necesidad de tener recursos económicos con los que apoya en los gastos de su hogar, Esmeralda compra leche y elabora el queso de manera artesanal.
Invertirá en azúcar, sal, detergentes, granos básicos, golosinas, pan, aceite, entre otros productos que le ayuden a mejor el inventario del negocio, esperara atraer nuevos clientes, incrementar sus ventas y estabilizar su situación económica.
Esmeralda aspira seguir trabajando para cumplir con la responsabilidad de dar a su familia un ambiente más confortable y  cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Esmeralda has a basic goods store and sells fresh cheese. She lives with her husband and three children, two of which are in school. Her business started due to the need to obtain financial resources in order to help with the household expenses. Esmeralda buys milk and makes artisanal cheese. 

She will invest in sugar, salt, detergents, basic grains, sweets, bread, and oil, among other products that help her improve the store's inventory. She hopes to attract new customers, increase her sales, and stabilize her financial situation. 

Esmeralda aspires to continue working in order to fulfill her responsibility of giving her family a more comfortable environment and to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to invest in sugar, salt, detergents, basic grains, sweets, bread, and oil, among other products that help her improve the store's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in cleaning his 2 acres and helping his sons clean their plots.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Sao is a rural villager who lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is 51 years old and she has five children. To make a living, she grows vegetables, and she also work as a worker to supplement the family’s income. She has been involved with her business for 15 years and she earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the seventh loan cycle for Sao with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. Now, she is leading her group of three women to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and a portion of it to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to expand her agribusiness, so as to better off her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Sarah. She is forty seven years old, married and blessed with three children. She describes herself as ambitious and aggressive. 

She earns her living by doing vegetable farming which she anticipates doing on a large scale. However, Sarah is constrained financially and so she is requesting a loan to help boost her vegetable farming. She will achieve this by buying fertilizer, pesticides and also hybrid seeds. This will ensure she maintains a consistent supply leading to more income. 

She will be in a position to take care of her expenses, provide balanced and healthy meals for her children and pay their school fees without difficulties.

Sarah is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is taking a Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase new spare parts to repair her sewing machine, as well as sewing threads and cloth materials. Elma is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts to repair her sewing machine, as well as sewing threads and cloth materials

loans.name: Pedro Paz

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja de dedica a cuidar ganado y aves de corral.

Pedro se dedica al cuidado de ganado, actualmente ordeña 4 vacas de las cuales obtiene 28 botellas de leche diarias y  luego las vende en las tiendas del pueblo y la otra parte su esposa la utiliza para elaborar quesos para luego comercializarlos, Pedro tiene 18 años de dedicarse al cuido de ganado lo cual le ha permitido salir adelante con su pareja, pero también se dedica a la agricultura desde sus 12 años, actividad que la aprendió de su padre, el lugar donde trabaja está a 2 kilómetros de su casa lo cual tuvo que comprar una motocicleta para movilizarse a su trabajo, el cuido de ganado lo hace de 4:00 AM a 6:00 AM y de 7:00 AM a 2:00 PM trabaja en la agricultura.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca.

Sus sueños son crecer económicamente y tener u mayor número de ganado que le produzca bastante leche.
texts.en:
Pedro is 38 years old and studied up to the sixth grade. He is married; his wife takes care of the cattle and poultry.

Pedro works with cattle. He has four cows and gets 28 liters of milk from them every day. He sells the milk to local stores and saves some for his wife to make cheese and sell it. Pedro has been working with cattle for eighteen years, which has helped him to make headway with his wife. He has also been growing different crops since he was twelve, taught by his father. He works in a place located two kilometers from home, so he had to buy a motorcycle in order to go to work. He takes care of the cattle from 04:00 am until 06:00 am and then works in the fields from 07:00 am until 02:00 pm.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy a cow. His dreams are to improve his financial situation and have more cattle in order to increase the milk production.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is Sole Owner of Pound Cake Clothing Company, a home-based business located in Sacramento and was first established 02/01/2013. 

The Pound Cake Clothing Company (PCC) is a small retail clothing company that offers plus-size women's clothing, shoes, and accessories exclusively for women ranging from sizes 1X to 5X. Yevette, currently offers a diverse and wide array of clothing for plus size women who seek colorful, trendy, and stylish clothing. 

She is looking for financing to make multiple accessories in a timely fashion by purchasing designer software, an industrial sewing machine, and different fabrics, to be able to offer more products for her clients and help grow her business.

loans.use: buy equipment and Inventory

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Srey is now 41 years old and married. She has six children. Srey and her husband are farmers who have been growing pineapples for 11 years. The current business earns them about 63,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs and they can afford to save about 40,000 KHR each day.
 
Srey is a second loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back the first loan. Her first loan has helped to relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income for her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
45-year-old Sakina is the mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband supports the family by providing transportation services to the local community, loading and delivering cargo with his own truck. He has owned the truck for the past five years, and due to heavy and continuous use, it needs some maintenance. 

Sakina's husband needs to repair the truck as soon as possible, but cannot afford to do so. So Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the repair costs. 

Sakina is so thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's truck.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 38 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su mototaxi desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela que lo busca por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar,  Samuel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas nueva y darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old and lives with his spouse. He has worked by making trips on his motortaxi for various years. He has many customers who seek him out for his responsible driving. 

Samuel is asking for a loan to buy new tires and to provide maintenance work for his motortaxi since it is his only source of work, and he hopes to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy new tires and provide maintenance work for his motortaxi

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 14, 6 y 5 años de edad. Rosa es pequeña comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace mucho tiempo. Gracias a su trabajo y a la ayuda de su esposo logra mantener el equilibrio económico de su hogar. Rosa desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, polines, pines, etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children that are 14, 6, and 5 years old. For a long time now, Rosa has sold fruits and vegetables in order to generate an income. Thanks to her work and to the help she gets from her husband, she has been able to support her household.

Rosa wants to repair the roof of her home because it is falling apart.  With this loan she will buy galvanized sheets, beams, fasteners, etc.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, beams, and fasteners to fix her roof.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José tiene 63 años de edad y desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de lácteos especialmente de leche y queso. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. José  desea reparar el techo de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old and for a long time he has worked in sales, selling milk and cheese. This work has enabled him to support his household and provide his family with what they need.  

José needs to repair the roof of his home and that is why he is seeking a loan from FUSAI. He will invest the money in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, iron, etc.  He hopes to be able to count on this financing and then pay it back as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, iron, etc. in order to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado. Está casado desde hace 34 años su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tuvieron 9 hijos de los cuales solo dos están en casa.

José se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles, maicillo, entre otros productos desde hace 40 años; porque su padre le enseño la actividad, desde muy joven. Otra actividad económica que tiene es la albañilería cuando no está trabajando en lo agrícola, de ahí tiene un ingreso adicional. En el trabajo se involucra un hijo que es quien le ayuda.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes semillas, para iniciar la siembra maíz, el frijol para iniciar la siembra debido a que este es el tiempo justo para hacerlo.  

José sueña con que su negocio crezca y para eso desea cultivar otros productos que le permitan tener mejores ingresos  para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old and studied in school until the 6th grade.  He has been married to his wife for 34 years and she works as domestic help.  They have nine children but only two of them still live at home with them.

José works in agriculture. He grows basic grains like corn, beans, sorghum, and others like these. He has done this work for the past 40 years.  His father taught him the work when he was young. He also owns a masonry business and when he is not working in agriculture he earns supplemental income from masonry.  He works with a young man that helps him.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds so that he can plant corn and beans. This is the time of year for planting his crops.

José dreams that his business will grow and because of this dream, he wants to grow other products that will enable him to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds in order to plant corn and beans, as this is the right time to do it.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como obrero de campo en su ciudad natal, Santiago. Debido a las situaciones económicas en su casa y a la necesidad de trabajar por su pequeño hijo, no pudo estudiar una profesión, pero esto lo ayudó a luchar cada día por sus sueños porque quiere que su hijo tenga un futuro mejor y sea un gran profesional.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar los trámites para el título de propiedad de su casa que sus padres le están cediendo, con esta tranquilidad él seguirá esforzándose por su hijo para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man with the desire to get ahead.  He works in farming in his city of birth, Santiago. Because of his family’s economic situation, and because he needs to work to support his young son, he was not able to study for a profession.  However, this helped him fight each day for his dreams because he wants his son to have a better future and become a professional.

Luis is seeking a loan from Kiva in order to get the financial support he needs to complete the documentation procedures for the title of the home that his parents are giving him. Accomplishing these procedures will give him the tranquility he needs to continue fighting for his son and he will be able to improve his son’s quality of life and his future.

loans.use: to pay for documentation procedures for the title of his home.

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado comenta que por el conflicto armado vivido en El Salvador  no logro seguir estudiando pues toda su familia tuvo que emigrar hacia el país vecino para buscar refugio y protección, también porque no contaba con el dinero suficiente para poder financiar el estudio, 

Él está acompañado y es padre de cuatro hijos,  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuidar de los hijos en el hogar, en su vivienda vive su esposa y un hijo menor de 10 años que actualmente estudia en la escuela y son las únicas personas que dependen de él. 


José se dedica a la albañilería en construcción desde hace quince años, pero antes de este tiempo ya trabajaba como de ayudante de albañil,  al transcurso del tiempo aprendió el trabajo y hoy en día lo maneja a la perfección todo esto gracias a un ingeniero que le dio la oportunidad de poder trabajar en una construcción. Él trabajo que hoy en día realiza, aparte de dedicarse a esta actividad, se dedica a la agricultura siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol,  comenta que esta actividad la desarrolla desde que era pequeño gracias a su padre que le enseño. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 200 pollos de engorde y concentrado para los pollos  pues quiere iniciarse en esta actividad,  no  tiene experiencia solo el apoyo y asesoría de un amigo  que tiene amplia experiencia en el área. Gracias a la inversión obtendrá mayores ganancias económicas para su familia y también para poderlas invertir en comprar más pollo. 

José desea para su futuro en primer lugar,  tener un mejor empleo que le garantice obtener un mayor salario también desea agrandar la granja poder tener más pollos  y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y poder remodelar la casa y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
José, 42, studied until the fourth grade.  He says that because of the armed conflict in El Salvador, he was unable to continue studying, as his family had to emigrate to a neighboring country, seeking refuge and protection. Also, he did not have enough money to pay for his studies.

He lives with his common-law wife, and he is the father of four children. His wife devotes herself to housekeeping and to caring for children at home. His wife, and one child who is under 10 years old and currently attending school, live at home. They are the only people that depend upon him.

José has been working as a bricklayer in construction for fifteen years, but before this, he worked as a bricklayer's apprentice.  He learned how to do this work over time, and today he does it perfectly, all thanks to an engineer who gave him the opportunity to work in construction.

Now days, in addition to this occupation, he also works in agriculture,  planting basic grains such as corn and beans. He says that he has been doing this work since he was very young, thanks to his father, who taught him how.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of 200 broiler chickens and chicken feed, as he wants to embark upon this activity. He doesn't have experience--only the support and guidance of a friend who has ample experience in the area. 

Thanks to the investment, he will earn more income for his family, and he will also be able to invest in the purchase of more poultry.  

José wants to have a better job in the future--one that would guarantee better pay for him--and he also wants to expand the farm so that he can have more chickens.  In this way, he will be able to earn a better income, and be able remodel his house and have a better quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase 200 broiler chickens and chicken feed, as he wants to embark upon this activity.

loans.name: Evelyn Coralia

texts.es:
Evelyn está  acompañada desde hace 12 años,  su pareja se dedica al servicio de seguridad. Tienen en común 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando educación básica.

Evelyn es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, como perfumes, maquillajes, entre otros productos por revista. se decide dedicar a este trabajo porque quiso ayudarle a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar. El trabajo lo desarrolla en su comunidad y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día aproximadamente.

 El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar jabón, azúcar, aceite, café, entre otros productos que son demandados en su comunidad y que será de gran ayuda a la gente porque ya no saldrán lejos a buscar esos productos.  Pues ella desea abrir su propia tienda ya que vive en una zona ideal para el comercio y desea colaborar de mejor manera con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Evelyn has been married for 12 years. Her husband works as a security guard. They have two children who are studying for a basic education.

Evelyn is a merchant and sells beauty projects such as perfume, makeup, and other items like these.  She sells them via magazine.  She decided to do this work because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She developed her business within her community and her schedule is approximately 5 hours per day.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy ham, sugar, oil, coffee, and other products like these that are in demand in her community.  These products would be a big help to the people in her community because people are unable to travel far to search for them.  Therefore, she wants to open her own store.  She is already in the ideal area for commerce, and she wants to be able to help out even more with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy ham, sugar, oil, coffee, and other products that are in demand in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and candy for her general store.

loans.name: Mavzhuda

texts.ru: Мавжуда живет и работает на северной части горного Таджикистана. Как и многие другие местные жители Мавжуда занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она начала этот бизнес 5 лет назад. Вначале ей было очень трудно работать на поле, с раннего утра до позднего вечера, под горящем солнцем. Постепенно с годами она привыкла к труду, и теперь она постепенно развевает бизнес. Также она занимается скотоводством, так как она не получает достаточного дохода от выращивания сельхоз культур. В зимний период она в основном занимается скотоводством. Мавжуда обратилась за займом на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mavzhuda lives and works in the northern part of mountainous Tajikistan. Like many other residents of the region, she works in agriculture, a business she began five years ago. At first it was very difficult for her to work in the fields from early morning to late evening under the hot sun. But she gradually got accustomed to the work and now is gradually developing her business. She also works in animal husbandry, since she doesn't earn enough money from growing crops. In the winter, animal husbandry is her primary occupation.

Mavzhuda is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase livestock, which will increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy livestock to increase her working capital

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат 56 лет, не замужем, мать 2 дочерей. У Карамат среднее образование, с 1993 года она стала заниматься полеводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Карамат есть 1,89 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает хлопок, реализуя его оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячный доход доходит до 20,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Карамат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая. Доходы от полеводческой деятельности позволят Карамат сделать ремонт дома. Также она хочет приобрести дополнительно земельный надел для выращивания пшеницы.
texts.en:
Karamat is 56 and unmarried with two daughters. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture since 1993. Currently she has 1.89 hectares of her own land where she grows cotton, which she sells to wholesale buyers. Her monthly income is close to 20,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Karamat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to harvest her crop. Profits from this will allow her to renovate her house. She also wants to acquire additional land to grow wheat.

loans.use: to harvest organic cotton

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат 37 летняя жительница не большого района Чилинкул. Латофат разведена с мужем и сама вырастила двоих детей. Сыну 20 лет, он уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Дочке 16 лет, она студентка. Латофат врач и по специальности она работает 19 лет. Она параллельно дома занимается растениеводством. Сейчас Латофат готовиться к очередному посеву и ей необходимо купить минеральные удобрения и пшеницу для посева. Из-за недостаточного капитала она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Latofat is a 37-year-old resident of the small region of Jilikul. She is divorced from her husband and raising two children on her own. Her son is 20 and has gone to Russia to work. Her daughter is 16 and a student. Latofat is a doctor and has been working in her field for 19 years. At the same time, she has been working in agriculture at home. She is currently preparing for the upcoming planting and needs to buy mineral fertilizer and wheat to sow. She is requesting a loan because she doesn't have enough money for this.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and wheat

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noé, tiene una familia compuesta por su compañera de vida y una pequeña hija de 4 años, ambas dependen de Noé, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero; su negocio consiste en  elaborar estructuras metálicas como puertas, ventanas, balcones, etc., ofrece sus servicios a vecinos de la zona y otros clientes ya establecidos, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre.
Necesita capital para comprar hierro, laminas, pintura y tubos, al tener estos materiales finalizara los trabajos que le han encargado y ofrecerá mayor calidad de sus servicios, espera tener buenos resultados con la inversión, mantener su negocio equipado y ganar popularidad.
Es importante para Noé mantener su negocio con vida para cumplir el sueño de comprar su casa propia y dar a su hija un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Noé has a family composed of his common-law wife and a little four-year-old daughter.  Both of them depend on Noé: they don't have outside economic help.  His business consists of  creating metal structures such as doors, windows, balconies, et cetera. He offers his services to neighbors in his area and other established customers.   Noé learned this business from his father.

He needs funds to buy iron, metal sheets, paint and metal pipes.  Having these materials will enable him to complete the jobs he has already taken on, and to offer a better quality of services.  He hopes to have good results with the investment, to keep his business equipped and to increase in popularity. It's important to Noé to keep his business alive in order to achieve his dream of buying his own home and giving his daughter a better future.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal sheets, paint and metal pipes in order to complete the jobs he's already taken on, and to offer a better quality of services.

loans.name: Marlene Maria

texts.es: Doña María tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de nueve hijos, los cuales siete de ellos son mayores de edad y tienen su vida independiente. Ella vive en una zona donde es apta para tener animales de engorde como cerdos y pollos en el caso de ella, toda su vida recuerda haberse dedicado a esta actividad productiva con ayuda de sus hijos y nietos; los cuales viven con ella desde hace tres años que falleció su madre, por lo que doña María como abuela posee la custodia de ellos ya que su hija así lo había solicitado. Hasta el momento son un gran apoyo para doña María ya que le ayudan mucho en el aseo de los animales y alimentación, por lo que ella lucha con tener siempre el correcto cuidado de estos animales y venderlos con el peso correcto para que le paguen bien y poder pagar los estudios de sus nietos y generar ingresos al hogar, ya que en la zona donde habita no existen suficientes fuentes de empleo, menos para una señora con la edad de doña María. Eligio Fundación Mujer por la facilidad en los tramites y porque a pesar de su edad no se realiza discriminación alguna. En un futuro ella espera que sus nietos culminen los estudios y se conviertan en profesionales para que tengan un trabajo menos duro que el de ella
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and mother of nine children, of which 7 are adults and have independent lives. She lives in an area where it is appropriate to have animals for fattening, like chickens and pigs in her case. 

She recalls making a living off of this productive business for her whole life, with help from her children and grandchildren. They have lived with her for three years since their mother died. That is why Maria, as the grandmother, has custody of them since that is how her daughter requested it. 

Up until now they have been a great support for Maria since they help a lot in the cleaning and feeding of the animals. She struggles to always keep proper care of these animals and to sell them with the correct weight so that they pay her well. Then she can pay school costs for her grandchildren and generate income for the household since in the area where she lives sufficient sources of employment do not exist. Even less so for a woman of Maria's age.

She chose Fundacion Mujer for the ease in processing and because, in spite of her age, there is no discrimination at all. In the future, she hopes that her grandchildren complete their studies and become professionals so that they have a job less harsh than hers.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru: Ойша имеет золотые руки. Она делает очень красивые прически. Ойша предоставляет услуги парикмахера уже более 5 лет. Она имеет свою мастерскую в центре своего района. Она также делает стрижки, макияж миникюр и т.п. Ойша старается предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне и таком образом привлечь больше клиентов. Она воспитывает 2 детей. Ее муж тоже занимается бизнесом. Ойша хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки фена, расчёски, лак для волос, краски и другие необходимые средства для своего салона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Oysha has golden hands. She creates very beautiful hairstyles. She has been working as a hairdresser for more than five years and has her own shop in the centre of her region. She also does haircuts, makeup, manicures, etc. She tries to offer services of the highest quality and in such a way to attract more clients. She is raising two children and her husband also runs a business.

Oysha wants to expand her business and increase her revenue. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to purchase a hairdryer, hairbrush, hairspray, makeup and other necessary items for her salon. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing and makeup supplies to increase her working capital

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad,  no asistió a la escuela por la escasez de recursos económicos en su casa, se casó, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la elaboración de petates para comercializarlos, son padres de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo tres viven en su casa y estudiando están solo dos, los que también trabajan en su tiempo libre de estudio.

Él se dedica a la agricultura trabajo que ha realizado por más de 20 años y fue su padre quien le enseño a que se especializara en ser un buen agricultor, pues actualmente produce granos básicos para el consumo familiar. Camina 5 minutos desde su casa para llegar a la parcela donde tiene establecido su cultivo trabaja todos los días muy fuertemente buscando un desarrollo económico  familiar, sus hijos le ayudan a realizar las labores en su tiempo libre.

El crédito lo necesita para cancelar una deuda que solicito en otro banco donde está pagando intereses muy altos, también parte del dinero lo invertirá en mejorar su casa para que este más segura y más bonita y su familia se sentirá mejor.

Él planea remodelar su casa y vivir en un ambiente mejor también ayudar en todo lo posible a sus hijos para que se preparen academicamente y tengan más oportunidades en la vida y seguir trabajando fuertemente para salir adelante.
texts.en: Jose is 46 years old. He did not attend school because of lack of financial resources in his home. He is married. His wife works in household chores and makes sleeping mats to sell. They have four children: only three of them live in their house, and only two of them are studying and working in their free time from school. Jose works in agriculture, a job he has done for more than 20 years. His father is the one who taught him to be a good farmer, and currently he produces basic grains for family consumption. He walks five minutes from his house to get to the land plot where he has his crops. Every day, he works very hard to improve the family finances. In their free time, his children help him with his work. He needs the loan to pay off a loan he requested from another bank where he is paying very high interest. Also, he will invest part of the money to improve his house so it is safer and prettier, and his family will feel better. He plans to remodel his house and live in a better environment. He also wants to help his children in everything possible so they study a career and have more opportunities in life, and to keep on working hard to move forward.

loans.use: to pay off a loan he requested from another bank, and to improve his house so it is safer.

loans.name: Kim Sreang's Group

texts.en:
Kim Sreang is from a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. A 48-year-old widowed mother of six children, four of whom are dependent on her, she has been earning a living by selling grocery items and growing rice for 29 years. She also works as a paid employee to supplement her income.

Kim Sreang is a second-time borrower with VisionFund. Her first loan helped both her business and her family. She is now leading her group to request a new loan. Kim Sreang will use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale as well as fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes the loan will enable her to earn more income so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José, ha tenido beneficios con el préstamo anterior  continua cultivando granos básicos y mejorando la porqueriza, manifiesta que su situación económica es mucho mejor, el nivel de vida familiar es más confortable, por el momento no tiene dificultades para continuar trabajando.
Continuando con el buen desarrollo de su negocio solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar una vaca parida, de esta manera incluir la crianza de ganado, pues así también aprovechara la producción de derivados de la leche para mejorar la alimentación de su familia y comercializarlos entre sus vecinos.
texts.en:
José has had benefits from the previous loan:  he is still cultivating basic grains and improving the pigsty.  He says that his financial situation is much better and that the level of family life is more comfortable. For the moment, José has no difficulty in continuing to work.

Continuing the good progress of his business, he is requesting a new loan to buy a calved cow.  In this way, he can include raising livestock, as well as using the dairy products to improve his family's nutrition and to market to his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow and in this way include cattle raising.

loans.name: Malis' Group

texts.en:
A resident of Battambang province, Malis is a 38-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school. To support her family, she earns income by growing vegetables and selling grocery items.

Having repaid her past loans and now leading a group of two, Malis is requesting her fourth from Kiva partner VisionFund. She will use her entire loan portion to buy vegetables seeds. Malis hopes that she can earn more income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables seeds.

loans.name: Lyna's Group

texts.en:
Lyna, aged 20, is married with two children who are still very young. She is a rural villager who lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Lyna is a farmer who has been farming and growing pineapple for 10 years to make a living. She can earn about KHR 42,000 per day from her current business and manages to save KHR 30,000 daily for future needs.
 
This is the second loan for Lyna with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Lyna wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and gasoline as fuel for pumping water. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and gasoline as fuel for pumping water

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Long, aged 46, is the mother of six children, two of whom are still in school. For the past 11 years, Long and her husband have made a living through farming rice. Their current business earns them about 29,000 KHR per day and they are able to save about 20,000 KHR daily for future needs.

This is Long's second loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Long is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland and to pay for labour. She hopes to produce larger crops to sell for a good price to improve  her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland and to pay for labour

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya, aged 54, is married with two children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by raising chickens and working for others for a fee. This currently earns them about KHR 22,000 per day and they manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day after expenses.
 
This is Ya's fifth loan from VisionFund. She is now leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more chickens to raise. She hopes to fatten her chickens so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sokoat

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area in Kampong Cham province's Dambae district, Sokoat is 24 years old and married. He has one child who is still too young for school. Sokoat has been growing cassava and cashews for four years. To earn more income, he also works for others for a fee. This currently earns him about 50,000 KHR per day to support his family’s needs. 

Sokoat has now been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles:  he wisely and successfully used the previous two loans to improve his family’s livelihood. Sokoat is going to use his loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to grow healthy and fruitful crops of cassava and cashews and also to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Noy, aged 30, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava in the local area. Noy has been in this business for 12 years, earning about  53,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

Noy has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is 45 years old and married with six children, two of whom are dependent on her. She and her family live in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing pineapple for 11 years. 

Sim is a third cycle client with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Socheat's Group

texts.en:
Socheat, 40 years old, is married and has nine kids. She lives with her husband in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living through selling grocery items. They have been in this business for 20 years. 

Socheat’s group consists of two members who live in the same area and she is a sixth cycle client. The past loans, which she successfully paid back, have helped her family support the business and improve their living condition. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Socheat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Met, 33, is a married mother of three dependent children. The source of her family’s income is from selling grocery items. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years.

This is the first loan for Met with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income from her current business

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en: Non, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 53 years old and a windowed mother blessed with three children. To improve her family's conditions, she grows tobacco as her main source and grows corn to supplement her income. For Non, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more farmland, fertilizer and seeds to improve her tobacco and corn. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more farmland, fertilizer and seeds to improve her tobacco and corn.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Loun

texts.en: Loun, 58, lives in Kampong Cham province and is a mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support four of her children. To support her living expenses, she grows cassava as her main source of income and grows rubber to supplement her income. For Loun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she will spend the loan to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sakhan's Group

texts.en: Sakhan, 49, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and is a mother of six children. She earns income to support her family conditions via rice cropping. In addition, she is a goldsmith to earn more income. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. In her group of three members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds to support her farm. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to support her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Milton José/ Marcio

texts.es:
El joven Milton, con tan solo 21 años de edad  vive actualmente con su hermano, su padre es conductor y de manera muy humilde su madre ama de casa, personas luchadoras con muchas aspiraciones en la vida. Milton labora y apoya a su familia en todo lo que puede.

El joven ha solicitado un apoyo económico mediante un crédito educativo para aprender el idioma inglés. Sus cualidades mas destacadas son el liderazgo, la responsabilidad, el interés hacia los estudios ya que son fundamentales para alcanzar el éxito.

Su motivación inicial, es poder alcanzar su vocación y es el poder aprender el idioma ingles como segunda lengua y a la vez honrar a su familia sobre todo a su hermano que le esta apoyando en estos momentos.

Desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país mediante sus estudios y conocimientos adquiridos, ya que quiere compartirlos con las personas que hoy en día tienen deseos y aspiraciones para lograr convertirse en hombres y mujeres de bien.

Como experiencia personal, Marcio comenta que la mejor enseñanza para las personas es la humildad, se siente identificado con esta palabra ya que el soñaba con estudiar en un centro educativo de mucho prestigio, pero reconoce que sus padres no tienen la capacidad económica para apoyarle a que estudie la carrera de sus sueños que es Relaciones internacionales, situación que lo llamo a reflexionar y optar por un centro educativo que le sea de mucha ayuda a el y a su familia en el aspecto económico.

Marcio reconoce que sus padres,son personas mayores que aun se sacrifican por el y por sus hermanos, sin embargo nunca han dejado de apoyarles en este largo proceso.

Su futuro lo visualiza de manera productiva, desea tener una familia que le apoye en todo momento, desea apoyar y seguir honrando a sus padres y hermanos y sobre todo desea convertirse en un embajador de Honduras.
texts.en:
Young Milton, just 21 years old, currently lives with his brother. His father's a driver and his mother humbly takes care of the home.  They are struggling people struggling who have many aspirations in life. Milton works and supports his family in every way he can. 

This young man has requested financial support through a student loan to learn English. His most outstanding qualities are leadership, responsibility, interest in studies because they are fundamental to success. 

His initial motivation is to achieve his vocation and to be able to learn English as a second language, and, at the same time, to honor his family, especially his brother who is supporting him right now.  He wants to contribute to the development of his country through his studies and the knowledge he has acquired, as he wants to share that knowledge with people who also have current aspirations and desires to become decent men and women.

As a personal experience, Marcio says that the best education for people is humility. He can identify with this word, as he dreams of studying in a very prestigious school, but recognizes that his parents do not have the financial capacity to support him in studying for the career of his dreams - that is, international relations.  This situation caused him to reflect and to choose an education center that will be a great deal of help to him and to his family financially. 

Marcio recognizes that his parents are older people who nevertheless sacrificed for him and his siblings.  They have never failed to support them in this long process. 

He visualizes his future in a productive manner. He wants to have a family to support him at all times.  He also wants to support and continue honoring  his parents and siblings.  More than anything, he wants to become an ambassador of Honduras.

loans.use: to study the English language.

loans.name: Silvia Haydee

texts.es: Silvia de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo busco la forma de llevar el sustento a su hogar sin descuidar a sus hijos y es por eso que viendo la necesidad de una venta de tortillas en su comunidad decidió colocar una venta de tortillas en su domicilio y así sostener la economía familiar apoyada también por su compañero de vida que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad. Silvia desea construir un muro de contención y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, polines, cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their three children (ages 16, 11, and 7). She is a woman who has spent a long time looking for ways to sustain her household without neglecting her children. Since she saw a demand for tortillas in her community, Silvia decided to set up a tortilla shop in her home. This allows her to support her family financially. Silvia also has the support of her companion who earns a living by providing security services.

She wants to build a retaining wall and replace the roof of her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of metal sheets, beams, cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron for building the retaining wall and replacing the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a retaining wall and replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Pursat Province, Ratha is 34 years old and she is the mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income for her family. She has been involved this business for ages. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the group leader for her group of two members. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en: Kong, 52, is a local villager who lives in Kampong Cham Province. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice and catches fish for resale to earn more income to support her family’s need. This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. Now she is a leader of a group of two. Kong will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and plow the field. She hopes that she can expand her rice farm bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plow the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun, 49, is a mother of five children living in Kampong Cham province. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice on two-hectare of farmland and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. The current business earns her about 48,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. Yun is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can expand her farm so she can improve her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en:
Ron, 53, is a mother of five children from Battambang province. She struggles for her living via rice cropping as her main source of income. Moreover, she earns more income via fish-catching to support her family’s need.

For Ron, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilize and seed, and pay the labor fee. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed, and pay the labor fee

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Residing  in Kampong Cham province, Chhan is 24 years old and a father of a young kid. Nowadays, he grows rice on an area of two hectares and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support his rice farm. He hopes that he can expand his farm bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support his rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Cham province, Ny is 46 years old and a mother of one kid. 

To support her living, she grows cassava as the main source of income and grows soybeans to supplement her income. For Ny, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

She is a leader group of two. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the labor fee, buy fertilizer, and pay the land fee. She hopes that she can improve her family condition better than before.

loans.use: To pay the labor fee, buy fertilizer, and pay the land fee.

loans.name: Srey Hen

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Srey Hen is 37 years old and  a mother with three dependent children. Two of her children are in school and one is too young. She grows rice as her main source of income. Also, Srey Hen works for others for a fee to earn additional income for her family. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns an  income of about 27,800 KHR per day.

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund  and she fully repaid her past loan. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kouy's Group

texts.en: A mother of two children who lives in Kampong Cham province, Kouy is 55 years old. She struggles for a living by planting cassava and earns additional income with her rice crop. This is the first loan for Kouy with VisionFund. She is leading this group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her cassava farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

loans.name: Samoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Samoeurn is 35 years old and a mother of two young children. She earns income to support her family via rice cropping. 

This is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sokheng is 37 years old and a mother of three children, two of whom are in school. 

She is a farmer who does rice as the main source of income to support the basic need in family. Beside her main business, she earns extra income via climbing palm trees to get palm juice to sell. She has been involved in the business for 17 years and earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader of the group, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee, and buy some materials to support her climbing of palm trees. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee, and buy some materials to support her climbing of palm trees.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Son is 64 years old and a mother to six children who lives in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows rice and soybean. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. She has fully repaid her past loans and she leads a group of two to get a new loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and earn more income so she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Samey

texts.en:
Samey is 58 years old and a mother of five children from the Pursat province in Cambodia. She earns her income by rice cropping in the local area. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Samey earns about 32,900 KHR per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan. She is asking for a new loan to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Pursat province, Chantha is 46 years old and she is the mother of six children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family via rice crops on two hectares and fishing to supplement her income. For Chantha, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of three, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland. In the near future, she hopes that her children can complete their studies successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey District where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Soern, 48, is married with six children. She and her husband grow pineapples as the main business for the family’s income. Having been in the business for 11 years, they can earn about 46,000 KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs. 

Soern has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income so as to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Rithy is 35 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. 

For her living, she grows rice as her source of income. Moreover, she earns more income via rice selling and pig-raising. This is the fourth cycle for Rithy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

She will take her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and she wants to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Pheap is 27 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school and another two are too young. 

To support her living, she grows pineapple and rice to earn more income. She can earn about 20,600 KHR per day. 

This is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loan. In a group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family condition, so that it's better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Nath is 34 years old. She has two children, one of whom remains in school. 

For her living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. Moreover, she plants soybean and grows cassava to earn more income to support her family’s need. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Nath will spend her entire loan portion to buy materials to support her hair and nail design. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy materials to support her hair and nail design.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
A villager in Battambang province, Yon is 53 years old and a mother of five children. 

To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland and does pig-raising. She has been working with her business for twenty four years. For Yon, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

She leads a group of two to get new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes that she can get a good yield and earns more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
A farmer who lives in Battambang province, Samnang is 49 years old and a mother of three children in school. 

She earns income to support her family via rice-cropping and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. 

She is a leader group of two and she will spend her loan portion to repair electricity for her house. She hopes that her house will have electricity to use like other houses.

loans.use: To repair electricity for her house.

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Thouk is 60 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is farmer who does rice cropping as the main business and cassava plating as a supplementary source of income. 

For Thouk, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. Now, her family is getting better. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes she can gain a good yield, and she wants to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамату 41 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Трое из них совершеннолетние и один несовершеннолетний. Мархамат занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает овощи и оптом продает на местном рынке. Она этим бизнесом занимается более чем 15 лет. Мархамат заботится о детях сама, так как ее муж в течение многих лет находится в миграции. Ее сын Чумабой учится в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса на 1 курсе в Юридический факультет. Мархамат должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и поэтому она обратилась за займом в сумму 1050 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Marhamat is 41 years old, married and the mother of four children.  Three of her children are adults already and her youngest child is still a minor.  Marhamat works in agriculture; she mainly grows vegetables, which she sells in bulk quantities at the local market.  She's been involved in this business for more than 15 years.  She is also taking care of her children alone, since her husband has been living abroad as a migrant worker for many years.  Marhamat's son, Chumaboy, attends the Tajik State University of Business and Politics, where he is a first-year student at the Faculty of Law.  Marhamat needs to pay her son's university tuition, and for this reason, she is taking a loan of 1,050 USD.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Srolao's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Battambang province, Srolao is 33 years old and a mother of a young kid. To earn a living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to support her family's condition. She has been in this business for eight years.
  
This is the first time for Srolao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to connect to electricity for lighting her house, and will use a portion of it to pay for electricity fees. She hopes to make her life better.

loans.use: to connect to electricity for lighting her house

loans.name: Sam Ath's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Sam Ath is a mother of four dependent children; two are too young for schooling and one is in school. To support her living, she grows rice as her main source of the income. Moreover, she grows soybeans and works as a construction worker to earn more income. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of four members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield to earn more income, and she wants to buy pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Chann, a local resident from Kampong Cham province, is 46 years old. She is a mother of five dependent children, two of whom are in school. For her living, she earns income to support her family's condition via planting cassava. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She can earn about 29,200 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. As a leader of a group of three members, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sam Eng's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Sam Eng is 25 years old and a father of two children. He secures the basic needs in his family via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. He has been involved in his current business for seven years and earns about 39,100 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

For Eng, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of two to get a new loan. As a group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee. He hopes that he can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Norma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma continua con su negocio de venta de lechones y tamales para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dúa a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando con su negocio para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicito el crédito para  la compra de manteca, carne, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
