This is Ngoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngoan has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Ngoan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngoan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry  to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl, está satisfecho por la facilidad de pago y apoyo que le brinda Padecomsm cuando lo necesita, en está ocasión opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono y pagar el alquiler del terreno en el que cultiva pipían, espera mantener la productividad y rentabilidad de su negocio.
Con los buenos resultados de la inversión del crédito anterior está motivado por continuar trabajando, Raúl ha mejorado la alimentación familiar.
texts.en:
Raúl is satisfied with the ease of payment and support offered by Padecomsm when he needs it. At this time, he is opting for a new loan to buy fertilizer and to pay rent on the land where he grows pipian squash. He hopes to maintain productivity and profitability in his business.  

With the good results from the investment of the previous loan, he is motivated to continue working. Raúl has improved the food his family eats.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay rent on the land where he grows pipian squash. He hopes to maintain productivity and profitability in his business.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, invirtió el préstamo anterior en la carpintería, ha tenido un impacto positivo, su nueva situación económica le permite dar a su familia un estilo de vida diferente y cancelar sus deudas. 
Por la facilidad de pago y los buenos beneficios que tiene de los créditos, nuevamente solicita apoyo para comprar un taladro, un cepillo, barniz, etc., equipara mejor la carpintería para realizar sus actividades diarias con mayor calidad.
texts.en:
José invested the previous loan in carpentry. It has had a positive effect. His new economic situation allows him to give his family a different style of life and pay off his debts. 
 
Because of the ease of payment and the good benefits the loans have, he is again asking for support to buy a drill, a brush, varnish, etc. He will better equip his carpentry business to do his daily activities with better quality.

loans.use: to buy a drill, a brush, varnish, etc. to better equip his carpentry business and do his his daily activities with better quality.

loans.name: 020404200002  Hải Sơn _  Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing net to do fishing and sell fish.

Hằng is 25 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 020404200002  Hải Sơn _  Hoằng TRường   solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net to do fishing and sell fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, vegetables, corn, oil, poultry, and other products and to keep making pupusas, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and cement blocks to build a storage room at his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and support beams

loans.name: Raksmey's Group

texts.en:
Raksmey lives in a rural area of the Bakan district of Pursat province; she is 29 years old and married with one son. To make a living, she has been growing rice and working as a paid construction worker. Her current business earns her about KHR16,500 per day. 

This is Raksmey's first loan cycle with VisionFund and she is leading her group in asking for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sokneang's Group

texts.en:
Sokneang is 48 years old and a mother of six children living in Kampong Cham province. She struggles to support her family's condition via rice cropping, and her husband is a house builder to earn more income. 

For Sokneang, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water pumping machine. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ricardo Ernesto

texts.es:
Ricardo, vive con su esposa y una hija de dos años de edad; se responsabiliza de todos los gastos de su hogar, la forma como genera ingresos es a través de la administración de una tienda que fundo hace 4 años, su esposa le apoya en atender a los clientes.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar cereales, granos básicos, aceite, pan, jugos, et., surtirá mejor el negocio para atender las demandas de sus clientes, además espera aumentar sus ventas y ganancias que utilizara para dar un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
Ricardo tiene la visión de tener un negocio mucho más grandes que le permita cancelar sus deudas y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his wife and two year old daughter.  He is responsible for all of the household expenses.  The way that he generates income is through the administration of a store that he founded four years ago.  His wife helps him tend to the customers.

He will use the loan to buy cereals, basic grains, cooking oil, bread, and juices, etc.  He will better stock the store in order to meet his customer demand.  He hopes to increase sales and earnings, which he will use to give his family a better lifestyle.

Ricardo has the vision of having a much larger business, which will allow him to pay his debts and to work with his own capital.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Ligia Marcela

texts.es: Ligia de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y hermanos. Ella es una joven tenaz y decidida que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante elaborando pan en una panadería cercana, lo que le permitió cancelar un crédito que adquirió con la institución y el que utilizo para construir un cuarto en su vivienda. Ligia se siente feliz y satisfecha con los resultados del crédito adquirido ya que logró construir su cuarto pero a este le faltan la puerta, los balcones y pintarlo, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: balcones, puertas y pintura para instalar puerta y balcones y pintar el cuarto que construyo en su vivienda con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Ligia, age 19, lives in her own house with her parents and her siblings.  She is a tenacious and determined young woman.  Every day she puts forth great effort to get ahead by making bread in a nearby bakery.  

This allowed her to repay a loan that she got from the institution.  She used the loan to build a room at her house.  Ligia is happy and satisfied with the results of the loan she got.  This is because she managed to build her room.  

However, it needs doors, balconies, and painting.  That is why she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan for balconies and doors.  She will install the doors and the balconies, and she will paint the room that she built at her house with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy balconies, doors, and paint.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

 Miriam se dedica a los trabajos de agricultura y ganaderia, y de igual manera a los oficio domesticos que realiza en su hogar, tiene tres hijos los cuales le ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo de campo y el de ganaderia.

Miriam inicio el trabajo de agricultura a la edad de 12 años, juntamente con sus padres, luego se independizo por si misma.

Con el crédito comprara 4 novillos de repasto para poder cuidarlos mientras se le venza el plazo del prestamo que ha solicitado y de las ganancia que obtega comprara los insumos necesarios para la agricultura.

Miriam sueña con poner sus propio negocio y poder tener mas ingresos por parte de la agricultura y poder darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Miriam, 42, is married.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Miriam works in agriculture and ranching in addition to the housekeeping chores she does at home.  She has three children who help her husband with the field work and the ranching.  Miriam started working in agriculture with her parents when she was 12, and later became independent.

With the loan she's going to buy four grazing heifers to take care of while she meets the deadline for the loan.  She'll buy the agricultural inputs she needs with the profits she earns.

Miriam dreams of setting up her own business, being able to have more income from farming, and giving her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy four grazing heifers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en:
Kean, 35, lives in a rural village of Pursat province’s Bakan district. She is a married mother of one child. Her family’s income is from leased rice paddy. She has been in this business for six years. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 44,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 20,000 per day for future needs. 

This is Kean's first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to get good crops from her rice paddy so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Shukurjan

texts.en:
Shukurjan is a homemaker from Dhupguri. She is 45 years old and the mother of one son, who is in grade 10. Shukurjan is uneducated, can only sign her name. But she is very much optimistic to provide education to her son.  Shukurjan lives with her family in a small mud house in the rural North Altagram in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband, 50 years old, is associated with paddy cultivation. From a very early age, Shukurjan's husband learned to work in agriculture with his parents who taught him all about planting and applying compost correctly in order to avoid causing harm. Shukurjan also assists her husband in the field in agricultural activities after taking care of her household work. They give a lot of effort to earning good profit from their business. 

Shukurjan's plan for the future is to increase paddy rice production by purchasing more agricultural inputs. This is how she can cultivate paddy on a large scale. Thus she is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan to buy more farm supplies such as paddy seeds, fertilizers etc. to help increase productivity of her paddy crop. She has a dream of making a concrete-made house for them and providing higher education to her son.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, se dedica a vender ropa nueva y diferentes productos según sea la temporada, su madre le enseño a desempeñar esta actividad, durante cinco años vendió billetes de lotería, pero desde hace 10 años se dedicó de lleno a vender ropa y artículos varios de temporada, su jornada de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde. Benilda vive con sus hijos, esta soltera. 
El capital será de ayuda para comprar nuevos estilo de ropa y sombrías, surtirá su inventario y por estar aun en época de invierno ofrecerá sombrías a sus clientes, espera recuperar lo invertido con un buen margen de ganancias para pagar la deuda sin inconvenientes y cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Su visión es crecer junto a su negocio dar a sus hijos educación de calidad y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Benilda sells new clothing and different seasonal products; her mother taught her how to do this work.  She sold lottery tickets for 5 years, but for 10 years now, she has devoted herself fully to selling clothing and various seasonal items.  Her work day is from 7:00 A.M. until 2:00 P.M. 

Benilda is single, and she lives with her children.

The capital will help her to purchase new clothing styles and umbrellas, add stock to her inventory, and offer umbrellas to her customers, as it is still the winter season.

She hopes to recuperate the investment with a good margin of earnings, in order to pay off the debt without problems, and cover her household expenses.

Her vision is to grow along with her business, to give her children a quality education, and to work with her own capital.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing styles and umbrellas, add stock to her inventory, and offer umbrellas to her customers, as it is still the winter season.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
32-year-old Sabita is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from a small village of Dhupguri. She is married to Mahesh and blessed with two children. Sabita sends her children to school. 

Sabita’s husband is a farmer; his income is not sufficient to cover the household and educational expenses of their children. To help her husband financially, Sabita wants to start up a milk and dairy products supply business selling curd, cottage cheese, ghee etc. By running her own business, she will be able to support her family and save for a secure future for her children. Her neighbors will her main customers. There is a high demand for milk and milk products in their area, thus she decided to start this business.

Sabita applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow for her business. With the income and savings, Sabita will be able to reach her goal which includes constructing a new and better house and better education for her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start up a milk and dairy product supply business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Purnima is from a small village of Dhupguri. She is married to Gokulchandra, and together, they have three sons. One son go to a local village school, and the other two could not receive much education due to their poverty. One of them works as a car driver and another one works as a mechanic.

Purnima's husband is a mechanic by profession; his income is inconsistent and insufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Purnima runs her own cattle-rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she gives support to her family financially. Now she plans to start a milk-products business, selling curds, paneer, ghee, etc., along with the milk to generate more income. Thus, she needs more milk. 

So, Purnima decided to take a loan to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of the business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income, she can run her family smoothly. This loan will give a boost to Purnima’s business and hard work. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk-supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, nails, and iron; and to pay for labor to build a room for his house.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a livestock farmer in Makueni town and has been in this business for 10 years now. She is 43 years old and a single mother of 4 children. 

She will be using this loan to buy dairy feeds and hay for her cattle. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future she hopes to be successful in her business, make more income and be able to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and hay for her livestock.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace's previous loan really improved her living standards. It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income so that she was able to construct her house.

In addition to her cereal-selling business, Grace sells dry fish. She is requesting for another loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy more stock of dry fish for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Unity Group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Rebecca, is 29 years old and has attended school to the elementary level. She's married to a taxi driver named Mohammed. Together they have one child, who goes to school and is in their care. 

Rebecca lives with her child and husband, and together they take care of the various family's expenses. For this reason, she's been buying maize, fish, oil and firewood to prepare kenkey (cooked corn paste) to sell to customers. She has been doing this business for the past five years. This enables her to provide for her family and for herself. Rebecca gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

To bolster her business, Rebecca, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a fifth loan from Kiva's partner, ID Ghana. They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble.

loans.use: To buy maize, fish, oil and firewood to prepare kenkey (cooked corn paste) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 57 years old with seven grown children. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. For two years now, she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sell soft drinks, bananas, sausages, chips, bread, chocolate and candies. This business usually earn her 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. 

Rosario is asking for a loan to increase her inventory. She will use the loan to buy chips, toiletries, detergent, canned goods, sausages, cooking oil, coffee, milk, candies and noodles. 

She hopes that with the loan, there will be improvements in her profit. In the future, she hopes to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy chips, toiletries, detergent, canned goods, sausages, cooking oil, coffee, milk, candies and noodles

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, a husband and father of four children, is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Moiben, Kapsowar. He has been practicing agribusiness for the past six years and has never looked back. For a living, Edward sells milk and food products from his farm into the local market. He makes extra money with a business running the only diesel posho mill in his village since there is no electricity connection. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied. 

Although Edward has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Edward is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kapsowar and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Edward does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. 

With this loan, Edward is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Edward will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 61-years-old and married with three children.  

Lilia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Lilia has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44-years-old and has thirteen children. Wilma is married and has seven children who are still in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 51 years old and married with six children. Avelina works very hard to provide for them.

Avelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Avelina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Avelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Florentina works hard to support her family.

Florentina has a dry goods selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Florentina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods such as plates, glasses, towels, and so on to sell in her dry goods selling business.

Florentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell such as plates, glasses, towels, etc.

loans.name: La Révélation A Group

texts.fr: Matthieu est propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de monnaies dans le centre ville depuis 2 ans, membre du groupe de crédit La Révélation A, client de l’IMF Hekima, marié, âgé de 40 ans, père de 9 enfants, dont 6 vont à l’école et 3 sont gosses. Il a commencé avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Sa conjointe est commerçante. Il va acheter les devises étrangères. Il souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Matthieu has been the owner of a foreign exchange bureau in the center of town for the past two years and he is also a member of La Révélation A loan group. He is a customer of IMF Hekima and is 40 years old, married and father to six children, six of whom go to school, while the other three are still very young. He began his business with funds from his parents. His wife is a trader. He is going to buy foreign currencies. He would like to get more loans so he can increase his turnover, educate and feed his children. Finally he is very grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who are not able to access banks.

loans.use: to buy foreign currencies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in an iron door and razor wire; and to pay for labor.

loans.name: La Révélation B Group

texts.fr: Rushingwa est propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de monnaies dans le centre ville depuis 12 ans, membre du groupe de crédit La Révélation B, marié, âgé de 44 ans, père de 7 enfants, dont 5 vont  à l’école et 2 sont gosses. Il a commencé avec de fonds de reçu d’un crédit après avoir hypothéqué le document de sa parcelle. Plus tard, il reçoit le crédit auprès de Hekima. Il Il va s'approvisionner en monnaie locale. Sa conjointe est ménagère. Il souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Rushingwa has been the owner of a money exchange bureau in the center of town for the past 12 years and he is also a member of the Révélation B group. He is 44 years old, married and father to seven children, five of whom go to school, while the other two are still very young. He began his business with a loan against a mortgage on his land. Later on, he got a loan from Hekima. He is going to get supplies of local currency. His wife is a housewife. He would like to get more loans to increase his turnover, buy a plot of land, educate and feed his children. Finally he is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to small entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to stock up on local currency.

loans.name: Jira

texts.en:
Jira, 30, is a married woman and has six school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother and has kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a carver from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved masks. He would like to invest in his workshop and use the funds to hire more carvers and transport his finished goods. Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "I learned the art of carving from my uncle. I had to stay with my him after my parents separated and he put me through school. It was fascinating to see how a log of wood could be used to create beautiful objects. This, I believe, initiated the desire in me to know and learn more about this art. I have trained several people and continue to train others. I also train students in second and third grade in senior school who visit the workshop." "I am grateful for your assistance. It will go a long way towards helping me craft more units and develop new styles." Use the link below to view Victor's hand-carved masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8743

loans.use: to hire more carvers at his workshop and transport his finished goods

loans.name: Zuleyma Azucena

texts.es: Zuleyma de 18 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una joven admirable que es muy reconocida por ser trabajadora y responsable, a pesar de ser madre soltera ella no se deja vencer y ha encontrado la manera de ganarse la vida sin descuidar a su pequeña hija, gracias a su negocio  de venta de huevos, ya que cuenta con 10 gallinas ponedoras las cuales le aportan alrededor de 3 cartones semanales, además cuida de un acuario cercano a su hogar. Zuleyma desea adquirir más gallinas y lograr así agrandar su negocio para que sus ganancias sean mejores es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de gallinas ponedoras y concentrado para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Zuleyma is 18 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and a 2-year-old daughter. She is an admirable young woman who is known to be responsible and a hard worker. Despite being a single mother, Zuleyma has not given up and has found a way to earn a living without neglecting her daughter, thanks to her business selling eggs. She now has 10 laying hens that give her around three cartons per week. In addition, she takes care of a tank [on a fish farm] near her home.

Zuleyma wishes to acquire more hens in order to expand her business so that her earnings can improve, which is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in the purchase of more laying hens plus chicken feed to enlarge her enterprise.

loans.use: invest in additional laying hens and chicken feed for her egg business.

loans.name: Delphina

texts.en:
Delphina is married and has six children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense are school fees for her kids and food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fruit and coconut selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 45,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a divorced mother of four children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Elizabeth dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 37 years old and widowed with one child. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more salon equipment such as hair relaxers and braids for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business, make more income and be able to educate her child.

loans.use: To buy hair relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and fees for her kids.

For the past eight years, Mariam has operated a mat-weaving sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that Mariam is requesting, she wants to purchase sewing materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials for her business

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is an artist and designer from Peru who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Adrian has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"In jewelry, I've found a medium of bodily expression. In the School of Fine Arts, I learned to express my ideas with a brush and oils. I can also do so through silver, gold and precious stones. I live in Peru doing what I love most; I am passionate about jewelry. For me, each piece of jewelry is a work of art, and I'm a perfectionist as I create them. I hope you enjoy the quality and design of my art."

"Thanks to everyone who is making this possible. This microcredit will allow me to craft more pieces and create new designs, which I hope will please all of my customers around the around."

Use the link below to view Adrian's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7520

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver

loans.name: Zilhi

texts.en:
Zilhi is an artisan from Peru who specializes in jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

Zilhi has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

It was through jewelry that Zilhi met her husband. "He taught me so much, and is still by my side, helping me perfect my work and giving me his total support. I find a great deal of satisfaction in my work. For me, my art is a fusion of fantasy and reality. My artistic name is Zilhi, in honor of our daughter, and it means 'Star'."

"Many thanks to everyone who plays a role in making this microcredit possible. These funds will allow me to continue crafting jewelry and supporting my family."

Use the link below to view Zilhi's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6738

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in recycled metal sculptures. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials and equipment for his workshop, including new soldering irons.

Armando has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

Born in a Mexican town famed for its traditional artistry, Armando dreamed of creating something new. "As a child I enjoyed inventing toys, and soon yearned to create a unique style of art. Enamored with nature and all that surrounds us, I now transform recycled pars into works of art. I began to craft figures from scrap and discarded mechanical parts, mostly from cars and bicycles. Thanks to the creativity that God gave me, today I have an enjoyable and better way of life."

"Many thanks for making this microcredit possible. The faith that you have in us and in our work inspires us to keep growing every day both as artisans and as human beings."

Use the link below to view Armando's recycled metal sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4923

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials and equipment for his workshop

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 52 года, замужем, старшие дети живут отдельно, двое младших - с Батмой и ее супругом. У Батмы среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав более 30 лет назад. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Батмы, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 4 коровы и 16 овец. Также на 0,91 ГА собственной земли Батма выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своей животноводческой деятельности, Батма обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 1 дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Батма направит на дальнейшее увеличить поголовья скота. Бизнес Батмы по ее замыслу должен помочь накопить средства на постройку нового дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Batma is 52 and married. Her older children live on their own and the two youngest still live with her and her husband. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began more than 30 years ago. Thanks to her purposefulness and hard work, she now has four cows and 16 sheep, as well as 0.91 hectares of her own land where she grows barley.

With the goal of further developing her animal husbandry business, Batma has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow. She intends to put profits from the loan into further increasing her head count of livestock, and to save toward building a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has a grocery business in Makueni town and has been running this business for six years now. She is 36 years old and married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, onions and vegetables for selling. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and service the loan. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, her hopes are to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Neide

texts.en:
Neide is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in handbags and accessories crafted from soda can tops. She would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including paint, soda can tops, fabric for lining, and crocheted thread.

Neide has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story:

When she retired, Neide moved to Rio de Janeiro searching for better career opportunities for her husband, a singer. "One day I saw a woman making belts with recycled objects. She offered to teach me how to crochet using recycled objects. I decided to use soda can tops, so I started going up and down the beach and city streets collecting them. I took my bags to the beach, and started selling them there. I am now in a position to offer employment to many young girls from the favelas."

"Your support really encourages me to continue with my craft. This microcredit will allow me to purchase raw materials and prepare a healthy collection of items for the holiday season. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Neide's handbags and accessories from soda can tops on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4536

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials for her handbags and accessories

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Beatrice operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past eight years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
“When people come together, they are powerful,” says Mathew, a 26-year-old farmer who is single and lives in the village of Kapsaiya in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. As a young boy, he watched women in his village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led him to join Ogikgei self-help group. 

For the past three years he has been actively involved in mixed farming. He never got the chance to get a white collar job but this has not been a set back because Mathew has been making great profits in farming. Kapsowar is one of the places that have favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming that is good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Mathew has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge he has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground. 

He is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Through Ogikgei self-help group which is a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, he joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan he intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow him transport the produce faster to an international market hence making more money. This loan will improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Omorde Bor Group

texts.en:
These people are part of group called Omoden Bor. They live in the same area and sell linens and jewelry. Justina is a single and mother who sells jewelry. She asks for 2,000 GHS to buy more jewelry to sell to customers. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her daughter who is training to be a nurse. She has more than 18 years experience in this business and is applying for her eighth loan with ID-Ghana. She works from 7 am until 8 pm.The group has received proper orientation about the loan and saving principals and promise to utilize this loan judiciously. In the future, and with the help of the institution, she would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 2500 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Cumez Group

texts.en:
The weekly markets in Chichicastenango, Guatemala, are known to be among the largest and most colorful in the Americas. Vendors arrive from all parts of the country and set up in the early hours of the morning. When visitors arrive, they slowly walk through crowded aisles viewing hundreds of traditional colorful textiles, an amazing variety of arts and crafts. The smoke from copal incense burned on the steps of the church permeates the entire market. It is truly a rich sensory experience in every way.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cumez” is located in the busy town. Sebastiana is a 53-year-old married member of the Trust Bank with six children. As a child, Sebastiana learned to weave and embroider the unique and beautiful blouses called “huipiles” that the women proudly wear. Each town has its own pattern and style and those from Chichicastenango are quite colorful and filled with geometrical designs or flowers. They take many weeks or months to fabricate. Sebastiana has enjoyed success in her textile business and has been able to generate extra income to support her family. At this time of year, business usually increases and Sebastiana wants to meet the increased demand of her customers and so she is requesting a loan. She will use the funds to purchase good quality thread in a variety of colors and other necessary supplies.

Sebastiana and her thirteen friends in the Trust Bank appreciate the opportunity to access practical information that will help them manage their loans and help their families. Each month at the meeting of the Trust Bank, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer offers the women educational seminars given in their native language of Maya-kiche. Some of the topics discussed include women’s health, empowerment and self-esteem, hygiene, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants as well as essential information about effective business management practices. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus” and it is very effective.

The ladies of the Trust Bank extend their gratitude to KIVA investors from throughout the world for their kindness and generosity in funding their loans. We look forward to providing a follow up report on the fourteen women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cumez”.

loans.use: to purchase good quality thread and other necessary supplies

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.en:
Sacapulas is a town in the Highlands of Guatemala that has been known since colonial times for the production of black salt or “sal negra”.  The salt can only be extracted from one of two rivers in the town between January and April. It used to be the main business activity of the municipality but now, few are involved in the endeavor as it has become quite complicated. 

Nine women of the town have joined forces and created the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Buen Samaritano” or “The Good Samaritan”.  Fiercely traditional, the women celebrate their rich cultural heritage in many ways. They all speak their indigenous language of K’iché and only a few understand Spanish. They wear traditional dress or “traje”. They share the common goal of raising their standards for themselves and their families, eliminating poverty in their lives and moving ahead into a brighter and more prosperous future. Some of their businesses include a “tortilleria” or a shop where tortillas are made three times each day, vegetable sales, a tomato farm and a convenience store.

One of the members of the Trust Bank is 26 year old Magdalena who has a small convenience store. She employs a young man to help her in the store as business is expanding. She needs to increase her inventory and purchase essential items like rice, beans, noodles, sugar, cold cuts and other items. In addition, she has a plan to open an additional store and fill it with items for everyday consumption like her first store. For all these reasons, Magdalena is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she hopes will be funded by Kiva investors.

Magdalena and her friends in the Trust Bank are keenly aware of the importance of education, both for themselves as businesswomen and heads of household and for their children. Magdalena is pleased that two of her children attend school. Her success in her convenience store is partially due to what she has learned from the monthly meetings of her Trust Bank when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares practical and useful information on a variety of relevant subjects. The women learn about effective business management practices, nutrition, health and hygiene, women’s rights and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Kiva investors are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in providing loans and opportunities for Magdalena and the women in the Trust Bank “El Buen Samaritano”.  The ladies extend their heartfelt gratitude to all. They feel hopeful about their future and we look forward to reporting on their progress.

loans.use: To purchase essential items like rice, beans, noodles, sugar, cold cuts and other items

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 47-years-old, married and has nine children. Five of her children are in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arely Elizabel

texts.es: Arely de 32 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos un varón de 13 años y una niña de 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia decidió hace 6 años dedicarse a la crianza de pollos en su vivienda, por lo que desde esa fecha su negocio ha sido de mucho apoyo para ella, además su compañero de vida apoya en los gastos del hogar gracias a su trabajo en una lechería. Arely con los años que tiene de tener su negocio de pollos, ha observado que cada día son más los clientes que buscan sus productos por ser de excelente calidad por lo que ella ha tomado la decisión de ampliarlo comprando más pollos y más concentrado, pero sabe que eso no será posible sin la ayuda de una institución, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos y concentrado para seguir ampliando y mejorando su negocio con la finalidad de tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Arely, who is 32 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her life's companion and their two children, a 13-year-old boy and an 11-year-old girl. Arely is searching for a means of improving her family's condition of life. Some six years ago, she decided to raise chickens at home, and as a result, since then, her business has been of much help to her. Moreover, her life's companion helps with household expenses, thanks to his work at a dairy.

Arely, with her years in the chicken business, has noted that each day there are more customers looking for her products, due to their excellent quality. So, she has decided to expand, purchasing more chickens and more chicken feed. But she knows that this [expansion] will not be possible without the aid of a [micro-finance] institution, and for that reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in additional chickens and chicken feed, in order to continue expanding and improving her business and have a better income.

loans.use: to invest in more chickens and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona, 35, a resident of Taguig, Philippines, is married to Jasper, a government employee, and has three children; two are in high school and one is in elementary school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal household needs and to send her children to school. 

Rona is a dog breeder. She intentionally mates selected dogs with the intent to maintain or produce puppies of specific qualities and characteristics then sells them to interested buyers. Initially ownership of purebred dogs was a privilege of the wealthy but nowadays Filipinos can afford to buy a dog. Dogs as pets have become a member of the family to many as dog is a man's best friend. Rona's friends, relatives and neighbors go to her and request in advance to breed dogs for them so she already has a captured market. She earns at least 40,000 a month in sales.

To help her in her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan which she will use to buy four Zhie  Zhu dogs, dog food, and shampoo for the dogs. She is positive that she will earn from her sure customers. Her earnings help meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rona hopes to be successful dog breeder. She strives to hard to send her children to school until college. She prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for dogs, dog food, shampoo for the dogs.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 65 years old and married with four children. Natividad works very hard to provide for them.

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Natividad has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eularie

texts.en:
Eularie, who is 29, is married with two children aged between eight and three years, and one of them attends school. 

Eularie sells home equipment and has been selling in this business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more plates and forks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more plates and forks to sell

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айнагул есть 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 9 овец. На земельном участке мерою 0,91 ГА, она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход Айнагул составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет купить юрту для того, чтобы иметь возможность пасти скот на пастбище.
texts.en:
Ainagul successfully paid off her previous loan, which was used as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to all the investors who helped her financially. Currently she has three cows, one horse and nine sheep as well as 0.91 hectares of land where she grows barley. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Ainagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase dairy cows to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of domestic livestock and wants to purchase a yurt so she can pasture her animals.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Rubylen

texts.en:
Rubylen is 36 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Rubylen is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rubylen requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rubylen has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rubylen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jagat Janani Group

texts.en:
In August 2014, 10 rural women of poor backgrounds from the village Kodobeda of Nuapada district of Odisha, India, united together and formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Jagat Janani to avail themselves of a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for extension of their existing businesses for better living conditions for their families. 

Sebani is one of them, and is sitting with raised hand in the photo. She is 29 years old and residing with her husband, a son and a daughter. 

Sebani has a vegetable cultivation farm with a dog well for watering with a traditional water lifting system. She and her husband look after the farm. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbages, chili, cucumbers, papayas, ladies finger, popcorn, etc., in the farm. Traders from nearby towns come to her farm for lifting the products for selling. 

She earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR from the above businesses. Sebani said this income is not sufficient for her to save some for the better education of her children and construct a good house for her family. So for the expansion of her farming, she has taken a loan of 16,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. From this loan, she has planned to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides, and purchase a diesel water lifting pump for smooth watering of her farm. 

She expects a good return from this investment to change her style of livelihood and be a respectable person.

Among the other nine members of the group, two are doing farming, four members are running general stores, and the next three members are doing milk selling businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for the farm, and purchase a diesel water lifting pump for smooth watering.

loans.name: For Christ Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of For Christ group from Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of three members who earn their living by selling cow legs, fruits, grocery and general goods. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Gladys is a 57-year-old married woman and has no dependent children. In the picture, she is standing far right. Gladys is engaged in the selling of cow legs and fruits. She is applying for her seventh loan with ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase more cow legs and fruits to sell to her customers. On behalf of her colleagues, Gladys expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: To purchase more cow legs and fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Munkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbold, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power plant for 18 years. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their youngest child. Their eldest child goes to elementary school, while the second son stays at kindergarten. 

He is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy planks and metals in order to repair fences surrounding his house. Currently there are many gaps between the fences, and then lots of stray dogs are trespassing on his land and scaring his wife and children. Repairing fences would solve this problem.

loans.use: to repair fences surrounding his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход молодой и энергичный человек. Он родился в 1994 году. Фарход учится на 3 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Фарход учится в факультете Экономика. Он учится успешно. Фарход обычно получает хорошие и отличные оценки. Фарход холостой. Он живет с родителями. Его родители простые фермеры. Они не имеют денег, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор Фархода и поэтому он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора за 3 курс. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farhod is an energetic young man who was born in 1994. He is a third-year student at Tajik State University of Politics and Business, in the faculty of economics. He is a successful student who usually receives good and excellent grades. He is a bachelor and lives with his parents, who are simple farmers. They don't have the money to pay for his education and therefore Farhod is requesting a loan to pay his third-year university tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 56 years old and chose to be single. He is a farmer, who is living in a rural community. He plants and harvests various vegetables for sale. He aims to improve his farming business and earn sufficient income to satisfy his needs and to support the education of his nephews. He wants to save some money for his future as well. 

Alfredo wants to expand his vegetable plantation, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed for vegetable production. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed for vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Banila, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase additional stock of mineral water. She also has an apartment and a direct selling business for added income. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 which she will use to buy more gallons of mineral water and some personal and beauty products to sell. She appears in her photo in her apartment for rent. Her earnings from her businesses helps meet her daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance form the financial help that will be given her.

Myrna hopes to own a place for her water and direst selling business. She desires to give her family a better life and prays for a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking 54-year-old woman. She is married with one dependent child. She and her family live in Ghana, Accra-Chorkor. In order to support the family, Joyce works hard. Her husband also helps her when he can. Joyce joined ID-Ghana in 2010. She used her previous loans to buy distilled water in bottles and sachets (water bags) and sold them to successfully repay her loan. She receives a good income from the sale of distilled water in bottles and sachets. Now she would like to increase her business to earn a bigger profit. She is requesting 3000 GHS.

loans.use: To buy distill water in bottles and sachets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 24 years old. She is married and she has three children. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

She has a shop of second-hand clothes, and she is also selling in the market. Regina has been involved in these business activities since a year ago. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling her second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them as they are cheap and unique if compared to new clothes. So she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy short sleeve shirts, long sleeve shirts, blankets and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Theodette

texts.en: Theodette is 27 years old. She is not married. She sells shoes and has been doing this business for 2 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is married with two children. She sews dresses for her customers and sells material too. She has been in this business for 10 years and has expanded and grown gradually. She buys material from a wholesale shop, sews and sells to her customers. She displays beautiful materials which are sold to customers. Hilda needs this loan to buy more materials to sew and sell. She will buy beautiful material to increase her stock and attract both new and old customers. Her greatest desire is to educate her children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sew and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting and nails in order to replace the sheeting on her house.

loans.name: Abella

texts.en:
Abella is 38 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Abella is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Abella has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Abella would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 mes de edad. Él es un hombre que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar gracias a que presta sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa de la zona. La vivienda de Mario está hecha de lamina y el piso de la misma es de tierra, esto tiene preocupado a Mario ya que él desea darle lo mejor a su hijo y sabe que no son las mejores condiciones para que viva su pequeño y es por eso que desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y pintar las laminas que hacen la función de pared en la misma, sabiendo que no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para realizar las mejoras ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pintura, cemento, arena y grava para pintar las laminas de las paredes y encementar el piso de su vivienda sabiendo que gracias a su trabajo logrará cancelar las cuotas del crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Mario is 23 years old and lives in his own home, together with his life partner and his 1 month old son. He is a man who, thanks to his efforts and tenacity, has managed to provide for his family. He works as a security guard in a business in the area. 

Mario's home is made of sheet metal and the floor is made from earth. This worries Mario as he wants the best for his son and he knows that these are not the best conditions for his little one to live in. For this reason he wishes to put down a cement floor in his home and paint the sheets that form the walls of the house.

Knowing that he does not have the funds to make the improvements, he has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in: paint, cement, sand and gravel to paint the walls and put down a cement floor in his house. He is sure that, thanks to his job, he will be able to make the monthly repayments of the loan.

loans.use: to invest in: paint, cement, sand and gravel to paint the walls and put down a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 38 years old and married with four children who all attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ana Marie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Ana Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zaiminrene

texts.en: Zaiminrene, 29 years old, is married with two kids and is a resident of Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than a decade. Vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC last June 2013. Recently, Zaiminrene decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Ana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Ana has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from personal products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz owns and operates a computer shop business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for eight years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds other ways to improve her income so she could help provide for their everyday needs and expenses.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan for her business to continue to operate. She is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her computer units.

In the future, Ma. Luz wants to improve her profit from the business and she desires to always provide for the needs of her family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members in order to share stories of their lives and businesses. She also draws strength from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер умный, жизнерадостный и целеустремленный человек. Он родился в 1996 году. Алишер учится на 2 курсе Технического Института Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он учится по специальности экономист-программист. Алишер является одним из активных студентов. Он активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Алишер увлекается спортом, а еще он интересуется компьютерными технологиями. Алишер обратился за займом в ИМОН на сумму 700 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Alisher is an intelligent, cheerful and goal-oriented young man who was born in 1996. He is a second-year student in the Technical Institute of the Technological University of Tajikistan, where he is majoring in economics and programming. He is one of the more active students and takes part in campus social life. He enjoys sports and is also interested in computer technology.

Alisher is requesting a loan from IMON of $700 USD to pay his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a farmer, who is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to uplift their standard of living in order to give his family a better life. Aside from planting fruits and vegetables, he also has a hog raising business as an additional source of income. He wants to continue and improve this business, but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he would like to take out an additional loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy hog feeds, vitamins, additional pigs to raise, and materials needed to improve the pigpen. Through hard work and strong determination, Joseph believes that he will be able to make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, additional pigs to raise, and materials needed to improve the pigpen

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she earns well from this. Jenita also operates a foam making business. These foams or mattresses are usually placed on top of a bed base. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. In the future, she wants her businesses to expand so that she can give her children the best for their education. She has to work hard and with determination to make a better income. 

To improve sales, Jenita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 30,000 Philippine pesos, she can purchase a larger quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business. She sincerely lets you know of her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Jenita meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jesica is 48 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four school-age children.

For her source of livelihood, Jesica has been engaged in managing a little photo shop business for four years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity to help her husband in providing for their family needs. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of inks and photo paper for their existing family business.

Jesica has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her photo shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of inks and photo paper.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Arlene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arlene has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Renchinmyadag

texts.en:
Renchinmyadag, age 44, lives with her husband in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia.  She has been teaching chemistry and biology at a high school since 1994, and her husband works at a gravel factory.  They have two children who live on their own. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate her home.  After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, thus reducing air pollution in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 49 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult age. 

Nellie has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for six years already. She earns approximately 4,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing five piglets and sacks of feeds for her existing hog-fattening business.
 
Nellie has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Nellie hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets and sacks of feeds

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is thankful for the financial assistance that was previously granted to her, as she was able to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, foams and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Josie wants for her business to expand and hopes that she will someday manage her own mattress manufacturing company. She also desires to be able to travel abroad, and she hopes that her family will always be healthy and in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is a place where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for foam, fabric, and other materials needed in making foam beds.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: Silvia de 20 años de edad habita junto a su madre y sus 2 hijos. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos, prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, y es gracias a ello que ha  logrado salir adelante sin importar que sea madre soltera.
