Silvia está terminando la construcción de su vivienda, pero le falta la colocación de un techo, ella desea habitar su vivienda lo antes posible y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para colocar techo a su vivienda.
texts.en:
20-year old Silvia lives with her mother and two children. She makes a great effort to help her children get ahead through her work as a servant. It is thanks to this work that she has managed to support her children as she is a single mother.

Silvia is in the process of completing her house but it still lacks a roof. She wishes to live in her home as soon as possible, so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails for the construction of a roof.

loans.use: buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails for the construction of a roof.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 46 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband has no permanent work. In order to help the family, she operates a sari-sari (small grocery) store. 

In 2011, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store to increase inventory and be able to earn more to sufficiently provide for her family. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to increase inventory and be able to earn more for her family

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 adult age children.  In order to make a living, Marilyn works as a cook in one of the food houses in town.  For 5 years she has also been engaged in a direct sales business, selling cosmetics and earning approximately 3,000 PHP each month, which has helped her husband to provide for their family's needs.  

Marilyn has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional stock of cosmetics for resale.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years, and in the future, hopes to start her own sari sari (convenience) store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Ramira

texts.en:
Ramira is married with two children.  She is 53 years old and lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, in the Philippines.  For 8 years Ramira has been a farmer, growing corn and other vegetable crops to earn a living.  

Ramira has requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals.  She has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Ramira hopes to harvest more palsy (rice) and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana has been involved in business activities since 2011. She started with her own working capital of $180. She has a kiosk in her house, and she is requesting a loan of $700. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. 

She will buy additional supplies with the loan, including coffee, sugar, milk, slippers, cooking oils, candies, noodles and other things to sell, including soft drinks. 

She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She also raises animals like cows, chickens, pigs and goats.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, milk, slippers, cooking oils, candies,  noodles and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Tatiana Del Carmen

texts.es: Tatiana de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 mes de edad. Ella es una mujer que pone todo su esfuerzo y empeño para apoyar económicamente  a su compañero de vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de papas fritas y pastelitos de carne los que vende en su domicilio, y es gracias a eso que puede estar cerca de su pequeño hijo y dar un aporte a su hogar. Tatiana desea reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para reparar el techo de su vivienda sabiendo que logrará pagar las cuotas de este crédito con las ganancias de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
23-year old Tatiana lives in her own house with her husband and one-month old son. She is the kind of woman who puts all her strength and effort into helping her husband with his small business selling fries and meat-filled pastries out of their home. It is thanks to this work that she can look after her baby and the household chores  too.  

Tatiana wishes to repair the roof of their home since it is in poor condition so she has approached FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams and wood to build a new roof. She knows that she will be able to repay the loan from the money they earn from their business.

loans.use: buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams and wood to build a new roof

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen, 38, is married and lives in Caratagena, Plaridel, in the Philippines.  She has three school age children.  The income of her husband, who is a construction worker, is not enough for their daily needs.  With a desire to help her family, she engaged in a dried fish vending start-up with a capital investment of 3,000 PHP, successfully operating for 2 years.  

Belen is now planning to borrow 14,000 PHP from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2012, to purchase additional stock of dried fish to have enough supply for her customers.  She would like to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish.  Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to have enough supply for her customers.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 43 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de prendas de vestir, además para aprovechar la clientela vende sandalias de mujer, su compañero de vida también aporta gracias a su trabajo en el cual es el encargado de distribuir bebidas frías a diferentes tiendas. Sonia desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado por lo que ella espera contar con un crédito lo antes posible y así evitar que sus pertenencias se deterioren, Por lo que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
43-year old Sonia is a hardworking woman who earns her living selling different kinds of clothing and footwear to her customers. Her husband also helps support the household through his job distributing cold drinks to various stores.

Sonia wishes to change the roof of their house as it is in poor condition. She would like to get a loan as soon as possible to avoid having their belongings ruined. So she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to construct a new roof.

loans.use: .buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to construct a new roof.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 64 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children now at their adult age. 

Celso has been engaged in farming, particularly rice production, for 50 years already. He earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also receiving a monthly pension from one of the government’s security agencies of the country.

He has requested a loan to purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizers and insecticide sprays for his rice production activity. 

Celso has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, he hopes to acquire an additional parcel of riceland.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizers and insecticide sprays.

loans.name: Anchita

texts.en:
Anchita is 55 years old. She is a widow and has two children. She is a vendor selling vegetables to the people in their village. She sells her products on a house-to-house basis. She only generates minimal income; that is why she wanted to increase her merchandise for added profits. 

She is now asking for PHP 5,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes, beans, and squash to sell. She hopes to keep achieving good sales to save for her family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, beans, and squash to sell.

loans.name: Catherine Marie

texts.en:
Catherine Marie is 44 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age. 

For her source of living, Catherine Marie has been engaged in a coconut buying and trading business for five years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity to help her husband in providing their family’s needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts and copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) for trading.

Catherine Marie has been a member of PMPC for ten years. In the future, she hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and copra for trading.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 67 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child now at her adult age. 

Lilia has been earning income from a little sari-sari store business for ten years already. She is also receiving support from her daughter. Lilia earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of consumable groceries and other goods for retail.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for ten years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of consumable groceries and other goods.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира живет с родителями и братьями в горном районе Таджикистана. Ей 18 лет. Она успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Нодира поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Она учится успешно и является одной из активных студентов. В выходные дни она приезжает домой и помогает родителям по скотоводству. Так как они живут в отдаленном регионе, основным семейным доходом является скотоводство и выращивание сельхоз культур. Нодира обратилась в ИМОН за займом для того чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nodira is 18, and lives with her parents and brothers in a mountainous region of Tajikistan.  She has successfully finished secondary school, and is now studying at Khujand State University.  She's a good student, and is getting along well in her studies there.  On the weekends, she goes home to help her parents tend to their livestock.  As they live in a remote area of Tajikistan, this is their main source of income, along with growing crops.  Nodira is seeking a loan from IMON to pay for her tuition, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: pay for her tuition

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Фируза поставила себе цель стать известным менеджером. С этой целью она поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана. Фируза студентка 2 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители  Фирузы простые рабочие, ее отец таксист, а мать работает воспитательницей в детском садике и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Фируза обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
After graduating from high school, Firuza set herself the goal of becoming a well-known manager. With this goal in mind she entered the Technological University of Tajikistan, where she is currently a second-year student. She is a very intelligent and hard-working young woman who gets good grades and actively participates in university activities. 

Firuza's parents are simple workers - her father is a taxi driver and her mother works in a kindergarten - and they don't have the means to pay for her education. Therefore she has turned to IMON International to request a loan to pay her university tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in ingredients such as yuca, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Chin is aged 37 and married with four dependent children. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income. Chin also supplements this income by working as a garment worker. They can earn about KHR 40,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 14,000 each day for future needs. 

Chin is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chin wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 26 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Jessica is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jessica has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en: Mr. Bayar, 48 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods using his light truck since 2009. His wife is a professional interior designer and works as a freelancer. They have two children who live on their own. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as planks, shingles and fiberglass for house renovation. Last year they moved into an old house he just bought at a discount. As winter is coming, it became necessary to renovate his house so that they can live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Dashtseren

texts.en:
Mr. Dashtseren, 33 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a bearer at a private firm since 2002. His wife sells goods at an outdoor market. Their children go to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovations, so that his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, sus 2 hijos ya mayores y sus 3 nietos. Ella es una mujer que toda su vida ha hecho todo lo que está en sus manos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyarlos ahora que están grandes, por lo que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para cuidar de su pequeña granja de cerdos la cual tiene en su vivienda. Ana desea mejorar sus ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su negocio, pero sabe que necesita de el respaldo de una institución, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cerdos y concentrado para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 47 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner, their 2 adult children and their 3 grandchildren. She is a woman who, all of her life, has done everything in her hands to get her children ahead and to support them now that they have grown up. For this, she wakes up very early everyday to care for the small pig farm which she has at her home.

Ana wishes to improve her income thus she has made the decision to expand her business but she knows that she needs the backing of an institution. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: pigs and food concentrate to expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in: pigs and food concentrate.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijas de 18, 15 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que siempre pone todo de su esfuerzo por sacar adelante a sus hijas sabiendo que solo puede apoyarse en su negocio de venta de bisutería, el que le ha permitido estar cerca de sus hijas y proveerles lo mejor que puede. En la vivienda de Ana hay muchas necesidades pero la principal es una pila ya que como se observa en la fotografía, la que tiene actualmente se encuentra deteriorada, lo que causa que no cumpla su función de retener agua ya que está se filtra, por lo que Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo  y hierro para construir una pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 38 years of age, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 3 daughters, 18, 15, and 7 years old. She is a woman who always puts all her effort into getting her children ahead, knowing that she can only support herself with her business selling costume jewelry. This business has allowed her to be near her daughters and provide them with the best that she is able.

In Ana's house, there are many needs, but the main one is a wash basin and water storage tank, because, as you can see in the photo, the one she has now has deteriorated. It no longer serves it purpose, because water leaks out. This is why Ana is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron, to build a wash basin and water storage tank in her house.

loans.use: to invest in:  cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a wash basin and water storage tank in her house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 47-year-old married mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Lucia has been operating a general store in the Philippines for two years now, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Remedios has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

Remedios has been in this business for three years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Em lives in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 50 years old and married with one child. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer for 30 years, while her husband works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 47,000 KHR per day, and she can afford to save 30,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is Em’s first group loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Em wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Bakan district of Pursat province, Phal is 57 years old and widowed. She has seven dependent children. The primary source of her family’s income is rice farming. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. 

Phal has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve their financial burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava so as to increase her family’s income and better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Gilda Emerita

texts.es: Gilda de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 13 años y un varón de 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo diversidad de prendas de vestir, desde hace mucho tiempo, además presta sus servicios domésticos para obtener un ingreso extra. Gilda ya lleva mucho tiempo en su negocio pero quiere que este progrese ya que sabe que sus ganancias podrían ser mejores si invirtiera en él, y es para eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: otra máquina de coser, hilos, zipper, botones, etc. Para realizar mejor su trabajo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Gilda, 49, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children: a 13 year-old daughter and a 17 year-old son.  She is a tenacious woman who has been earning a living making and selling various garments for quite some time.  In addition, she works outside the home as a domestic to earn some extra income.  Gilda has had her business for a long time, but she wants to make progress with it, because she knows that her earnings will increase if she invests in the business. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: another sewing machine, thread, zippers, buttons, and other supplies. This way, she can improve her work and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 12 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por salir adelante siempre apoyada por su esposo y en su negocio de venta de tortillas, el cual realiza en su vivienda, además vende variedad de lociones y productos de belleza por catalogo. María es una mujer emprendedora que ha encontrado en su negocio la forma de generar ingresos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, cremas, champú, maquillaje, desodorante, etc. Para lograr así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria, 34, lives in her own home with her husband and their 2 children, a 12 year-old daughter and a 7 year-old boy.  She is a woman who has been working very hard to get ahead.  Her husband has always supported her with her business selling tortillas, which she makes in her home.  She also sells a variety of lotions and beauty products from a catalog.  Maria is an enterprising woman who has found in her business a way to earn income.  She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup, deodorant, and other items, so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Jessica Magaly

texts.es: Jessica de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 12 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que al observar que en su cantón era necesaria una tienda decidió colocarla en su domicilio y es gracias a ella que sostiene la economía familiar, apoyada también en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y lociones. Jessica sabe que el ingreso económico más fuerte se debe a su negocio y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, champú, etc. Para ampliar su tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Jessica, 32 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and 2 children, a girl of 12 years and a boy of 7 years. She is an enterprising woman who, when she noticed that her canton needed a store, decided to start one in her home. It is thanks to her that family finances are maintained, supported also by her business selling beauty products and lotions.

Jessica knows that her strongest economic return comes from her business, and that is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in: oil, rice, sugar, beans, corn, shampoo, etc., in order to expand her convenience store.

loans.use: to invest in:  oil, rice, sugar, beans, corn, shampoo, etc. in order to expand her convenience store.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Due to the hardships of life, Rogelio aims to improve his vegetable production business to earn sufficient income and provide the necessities for his family. He wants to plant more vegetables for sale, and so would like to access financial assistance of PHP 15,000.00 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. 

Rogello is hoping that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to start her shop.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en: Benito is a 40-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. Despite the hardship of living, he aims to educate his children and give them a better life. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he would like to access educational assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 to fully pay the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees of his daughter who is taking a Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy at PLTC college. Having this educational assistance, Benito believes that his daughter will be able to continue and finish her studies someday.

loans.use: to fully pay the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees for his daughter

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Margie has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like school supplies, home products and other personal items to sell.

Margie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like school supplies, home products and other personal items to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 52 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonarda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Leonarda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es: Berta de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer con una gran visión para los negocios, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado mantener su negocio de elaboración y venta de zapatos por mucho tiempo, ya que junto a su esposo son reconocidos por elaborar productos de excelente calidad, además ella presta sus servicios domésticos 3 veces por semana y así consigue obtener ingresos extra. Berta se siente feliz con su negocio, ya que deja buenas ganancias, pero ella sabe que si le invierte más puede obtener mejores ingresos y vender un poco más cómodo el producto, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: suelas, cuero, hilos y materiales sintéticos.
texts.en:
Berta, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner. She is a woman with a great mind for business, and it is thanks to this that she has been able to maintain her business making and selling shoes for a long time. With her husband, they are known for making excellent quality products. In addition to this, she works in domestic service 3 times a week, and thus earns extra income.

Berta is happy with her business, because it gives her good earnings, but she knows that if she invests more in it, she can get better earnings and sell her product a bit more easily. That is why she decided to apply to FUSAI for a loan to invest in: soles, leather, threads, and synthetic materials.

loans.use: to invest in soles, leather, threads, and synthetic materials.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 41 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que demuestra su amor a la familia, por medio del esfuerzo que pone en salir adelante prestando sus servicios en una empresa cercana, para darlo mejor a su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo de 13 años de edad. Él es un hombre que buscando siempre lo mejor para su familia ha tomado la decisión de cambiar el techo, encementar el piso y construir una pila en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina, pines, ladrillo y hierro para cambiar el techo, encementar el piso y construir una pila en su vivienda.
texts.en: 41 year-old Francisco is a hard-working man who shows his love for his family through the hard work he puts into getting ahead lending his services to a nearby company; he does this in order to give the best to his family, made up of his wife and his 13 year-old son. He is a man who always looks for the best for his family, and he decided to change the roof, cement the floor and build a basin in his home, which is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, laminated sheeting, poles, bricks and iron to change the roof, cement the floor and build a basin in his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, laminated sheeting, poles, bricks and iron to change the roof, cement the floor and build a basin in his home.

loans.name: Sindi Liduvina

texts.es: Sindi de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se ha visto en la necesidad de sacar adelante sola a su hija por circunstancias de la vida por lo que tomo la decisión instalar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 7 años y es apoyada en su negocio que ha logrado sacar adelante a su pequeña. Sindi desea mejorar el techo del corredor de su vivienda, y además reconstruir la puerta de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, pines, lámina galvanizada, y hierro para instalar techo al corredor y reconstruir la puerta de su vivienda.
texts.en: 29 year-old Sindi lives in her own house along with her 9 year-old daughter. She is a woman who has needed to get her daughter ahead alone due to circumstances of life; this is why she made the decision to set up a general store 7 years ago, and she has been supported in her business which has helped her little girl to get ahead. Sindi wishes to improve the roof of the hall in her house, and also wishes to rebuild the house's door. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy roofing materials, poles, laminated metal sheeting and iron to build a roof above the hall and rebuild the door to her home.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials, poles, laminated metal sheeting and iron to build a roof above the hall and rebuild the door to her home.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking mother who supports her husband in their vegetable production business to ensure a high yield. They aim to improve their farming business and their status of living to give their children a better life. To further improve their farming business, they need a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in planting vegetables. She is hoping that she will receive her requested loan to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en: Dionisio is 58 years old and has three adult-age children. He plants and harvests rice and vegetables that he sells in the local community. He aims to improve his farming business and to have high production and income. Due to insufficient capital, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings. He believes this financial assistance will be a great help for him to improve his rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Estella would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 25,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Estella dreams for her children to finish their schooling and to have their house renovated. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital and to repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Loreta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Loreta's business profile for a new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and has 10 children. Arlene is married and has five children who are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Alma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana, a 43-year-old  mother of seven, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been working in the public sector for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shabana provides sewing services, earning income to contribute to the management of the household. 

Shabana is requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan in order to purchase a variety of goods including needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business. This loan will enable her to provide better sewing services, thereby increasing her monthly sales and profits.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her sewing business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 11 y 1 años de edad, y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora, fuerte, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ un sitio caracterizado por su cercanía al lago Titicaca que conlleva un clima frío y la potencia de los rayos solares extremadamente fuertes.
Justina es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymara y conoce el español por el comercio. Su trabajo es la producción de queso artesanal; ella se encarga de producir leche bajo los parámetros exigidos en una explotación ganadera lechera, y espera lograr una producción de entre 4 y 6 litros/vaca/día de leche, dependiendo si es criolla o mejorada. En sus inicios toda su producción se destinaba a la venta de leche fresca, posteriormente perfeccionó sus procesos y la transformó en queso. La venta la realiza al menudeo ofertando en cada domicilio de su comunidad y a visitantes y/ó turistas.  Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida, ella desea realizar refacciones en su hogar y su establo.
Es por esos motivos que Justina solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su hogar y establo.
texts.en:
Justina is a 44-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children, aged 17, 15, 11 and 1. Her business is producing artisanal cheese.

She is enterprising, a good mother, determined, strong, patient, responsible and hard-working. She carries out her work in the community of ‘Batallas,’ a place characterized by its proximity to Lake Titicaca, which gives it a cold climate and exposure to extremely powerful solar rays. 

Justina is brown-skinned and of medium height, with long, braided black hair. Her native language is Aymara, and she knows Spanish because of her business. Her work is producing artisanal cheese. She takes charge of producing milk under the conditions required by a dairy operation, and she hopes to achieve milk production of 4 to 6 liters per cow per day, depending on whether the cow is of a traditional or improved breed. At the beginning, all of her production went into the sale of fresh milk, but later she improved her processes and transformed the milk into cheese. She carries out her sales on a retail basis, offering her products to each household in her community and to visitors and/or tourists. Her dream is to improve her quality of life, and she wants to carry out repairs to her home and her barn. 

It is for this reason that Justina is requesting a loan: to repair her home and her barn..

loans.use: to repair her home and her barn.

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es: Carlos de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una niña de 11 años y un varón de 15 años de edad. Él se esfuerza cada día  por llevar el sustento a su hogar, apoyado en su negocio de venta de lácteos que realiza de forma ambulante por las calles del municipio en donde ya lo esperan sus clientes para adquirir sus productos, además su esposa se dedica a la venta de golosinas frías como gelatinas, flan, charamuscas, etc. Carlos siempre busca darle lo mejor a su familia, y ha observado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: 37 year-old Carlos lives in his own house along with his wife and 2 children: an 11 year-old girl and a 15 year-old boy. He works hard every day to sustain his home, through his business which sells dairy products; he sells these from stalls on the streets of the town where his customers await to buy his products. Furthermore, his wife makes a living selling cold candies, such a gelatines, flan, 'charamuscas' (little bags of frozen juice), etc. Carlos is always looking to give his family the best, and he has noticed that the roof of his home has become worn; this is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan o buy laminated metal sheeting, beams and poles to repair the roof of his home.

loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting, beams and poles to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build walls around her house for greater security

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
His name is Rodel, 38, resident of Coron, Palwan, Philippines. He works in a funeral home. He is married and has one child who is already in high school. He works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

He works in a funeral home that is the only funeral home in their town. He owns a vehicle and rents it out to the funeral home to transport corpses from  homes or hospitals to their funeral. He earns at least 18,000 a month for his service. 

To help him in his transportation service, he is requesting for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy a new vehicle to improve his service. A new vehicle is much less to maintain and he is assured of efficient service. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him.

Rodel hopes that his transport service will continue to be successful. He wants to give his family a better future and prays for a quiet and happy family.  Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional vehicle.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: To have additional income, Adelaida operates her motorcycle transport to help her husband in gaining income. She is 48 years old and has has six schooling children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income in order to sustain their necessities and finance the education of their children. To continuously operate the motorcycle, Adelaida wants to avail a loan of PHP 30,000.00  to buy gasoline, motorcycle parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, motorcycle parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old and a widow with one child.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns more income from pig fattening and firewood retail businesses.

Nenita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 46-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Robina's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes.

But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products to resell. Therefore, Abida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags and milk

loans.name: Enelyn

texts.en:
Enelyn is 27 years old and has two children.  Enelyn is married and both of her children are in school.

Enelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Enelyn requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Enelyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Enelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy more coffee, beverages and tea and to repair the kitchen. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, beverages and tea and to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em is requesting a new loan to repair the restroom of her shop. This repairing will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the restroom of her shop.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture for her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana de 24 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día para apoyar en la economía de su hogar, gracias a su trabajo en una pupuserìa, además ella vive con su compañero de vida en vivienda propia desde hace 4 años, por lo que el también le aporta a los gastos del hogar. Ana se siente feliz y bendecida por contar son un lugar propio donde vivir, pero desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente, este se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en lámina galvanizada y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: 24 year-old Ana is a hard-working woman who puts in effort every day to support her household, thanks to her work in a 'pupuseria' (a shop selling stuffed tortillas). Furthermore, she has been living with her life partner in their own home for the last 4 years, who also contributes to household expenses. Ana feels happy and blessed to be able to have a place of her own to live in, but she would like to change the roof of her home, as it is currently very worn; this is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan, to buy laminated metal sheeting and beams to change the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting and beams to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo pone todo de su esfuerzo por sostener la economía de su hogar apoyada en su compañero de vida y en su negocio de venta de calcetines, el cual realiza en un lugar estratégico de mucha afluencia de personas. Ana sabe que su negocio aunque no es el único ingreso económico de su hogar si es muy importante, por lo que desea invertir en él para ofrecer más variedad a los clientes que solicitan sus productos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: medias deportivas, calcetines, calcetas, toallas, camisetas, etc.
texts.en: 19 year-old Ana lives in her own home with her life partner and 3 month-old daughter. She is a woman who for a long time has put all her effort into sustaining her household, supported by her life partner in her business selling socks; she does this is a strategic location, with big flows of people. However, Ana realises the important fact that her business cannot be her home's only source of income, which is why she wants to invest in it to offer more variety to her customers who want to buy products from her. This is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy sports socks, socks, towels, shirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy sports socks, socks, towels, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Justina

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, madre de 5 hijos de 14, 12, 10, 8 y 5 años de edad, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es independiente, constante, responsable, buena madre, fuerte y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Quehuaya’ del lago Titicaca; lugar donde se encuentra el albergue comunitario sitio donde se puede descansar para después abordar los botes a motor rumbo a la Isla Pariti, el trayecto a la isla en bote se realiza a través de laberintos de Totora (planta acuática típica del lago), con paisajes maravillosos. 
Bertha es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su forma de vestir es típica (manta, pollera y sombrero) y su lengua materna es el aymara, utiliza el español para el comercio. Su trabajo es la pesca, cada día al salir el sol; ella junto a su esposo o tal vez alguno de sus hijos se adentran al lago Titicaca y realizan la pesca de; carachi, mauri, ispi y trucha. Su labor es bastante sacrificada por el clima del lugar; que es frio y los rayos solares bastante fuertes. Ella sueña en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca y refaccionar su bote para mayor seguridad.
Es por esos motivos que Bertha solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca y refacción de bote para mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 33-year old woman, married and the mother of 5 children, 14, 12, 10, 8, and 5 years old. Her business is fishing.

She is independent, persevering, responsible, a good mother, strong and hard-working. She works in the 'Quehuaya' community of Lake Titicaca, where there is a community shelter, where you can rest before boarding the motor boats to Pariti Island. The route to the island is through the Totora labyrinths (an aquatic plant typical of the lake), with wonderful scenery.

Bertha has a dark complexion, long, black hair, medium stature, and a traditional way of dressing (shawl, traditional Andean skirt, and hat), and her mother tongue is Aymara. She uses Spanish for business.

Her job is fishing. Everyday she leaves at dawn. With her husband, and maybe one of her children, she goes into Lake Titicaca and fishes for: carachi, kauri, ispi (local fishes), and trout. Her work is quite demanding because of the climate of the place, which is cold and where the sun's rays are quite strong.

She dreams about improving her family's quality of life. She would like to buy fishing nets and repair her boat for greater safety. This is why Bertha is applying for a loan to buy fishing nets and for boat repairs for greater safety.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay for boat repairs for greater safety.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet requests a new loan to repair her bssauty shop and buy tools and shampoo to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity, and sales. 

She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her business, her income, and  help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her shop and buy  tools and shampoo.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 38 years old, married and has seven children. Four of her children attend school.

Crispina has raised livestock for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamin for her cow.  She has previously  borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Crispina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cow.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 39 years old and married with eight children.  Two children attend  school and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Maribeth has run a general store for 7 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maribeth would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung would like to take another loan to buy better quality dried fish to sell from her stall. 

Dung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong requests a loan to buy a range of new products, such as sweets and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store, increase sales, and  improve her living conditions

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as sweets and beverages.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of soft-drinks to sell. This purchase will help her better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and she hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales. She also hopes it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft-drinks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking single lady with one child aged 18 years. She runs a boutique, mainly selling ladies wear and clothes for men. Her dream is to expand and develop her business more. She will use the loan facility to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cay

texts.en:
Cay would like to take a further loan to buy better quality ingredients to make food to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a new squeezer cart for selling sugarcane juice. This purchase will help her better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that this new loan will assist in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new squeezer cart for selling sugarcane juice

loans.name: Wigiang Group

texts.en:
Tathoniu is a middle-aged woman pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured member of the group Wigiang. All the group members are from Makhan village, Manipur. 

Tathoniu has two children who are still in their primary school. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her family by selling vegetables in the market. Early in the morning, she carries a stock of vegetables and heads toward the market to sell various items. “Business is good in the morning,” she said. She makes a small profit from the vegetables she sells at the market from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. daily. This is the time when people will go to the market to buy vegetables for lunch and dinner. 

When she returns from the market, she will buy essential items for the household use on the way. After reaching home, she takes lunch and goes to their field with her husband and looks after the crops they grow. She also buys vegetables from suppliers for selling, since her production is not enough for daily selling. She requires capital to buy more stock of vegetables for selling purposes, since she has to buy from other people. 

If she stops selling vegetables during the off season, the family will be short of money for the household requirements. The small profit she makes provides for her family’s daily requirement, which make the business essential. 

She will use the loan for buying more stock of vegetables, including potatoes, ginger, mustard, corn, mushrooms, etc. She will sell the items to make more profit and earn more income so that her family’s financial problems will be solved. She is very happy to avail herself of the loan and said, “Thank you so much Kiva.” 

The other members of the group are also engaged in similar business activities. They will use the loan for buying livestock, saplings, and vegetables to generate income for their households.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables for selling in the market.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane needs a loan to pay school fees for her children. She operates a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar, salt and tea leaves to the general public. She desires to pay school fees for her children but competition hinders her retail business where she gets income to cater for her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Starneslous

texts.en: Starneslous lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is married and responsible for looking after seven children. He does farming, growing crops such as  groundnuts and sugar cane. He does this so as to sustain his family. He desires to expand his farm and modernize it. Price fluctuations are always affecting his output thus he earns a low income. He wants a loan to prepare his garden by weeding, ploughing, and buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and prepare his garden by weeding and ploughing.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42-years-old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a vulcanizing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment.

Gina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has seven children. Alex operates a bakery that produces bread and doughnuts. This is where he earns income for his family. He desires to educate his children. Competition affects his business. He needs a loan to buy flour for baking.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Nassur

texts.en:
Nassur is married and lives in Hoima-Uganda. He is in the retail business and charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children, one of whom attends school. 

He also earns a salary which supplements his income earned from the retail shop. He is a hard-working man who desires to develop and expand his business. He will use the loan to stock more general merchandise like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to stock more general merchandise like salt and sugar to sell

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 20-year-old single young man from Attel, a village near Tulkarem. He lives with his parents in a small house in the village. His father is a worker who earns a very low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. Isam is a student in a local university where he studies Business Administration. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to support his family and improve their living conditions.
 
Isam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Isam will be able to complete his studies and improve himself. Isam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Gemma is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 21-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He makes bricks and does farming. He faces challenges of limited capital. He also hopes to establish a good home and start a retail shop. Gerald needs a loan to buy iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his house

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 44-year-old married male living in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is responsible for taking care of nine children from the income he makes from his carpentry business. He makes chairs and beds. He also does farming to increase his income. Alex is challenged by competition. He wants a loan to buy solar panels for his home.

loans.use: to buy solar panels for his home

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is 38 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana Rose has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Ana Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 45 years old and married and has been blessed with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Roda has operated a farming business, selling her crops at retail and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of opening a kiosk in the near future.

Roda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase seeds for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, age 59, is from Marapong, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. She is a single parent bravely raising three children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Milagros applied to Paglaum MPC for a loan to purchase two sacks of feeds. In the future, Milagros wants her business to be well known, and she wants to build a well-managed business for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of feeds

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 40-year-old single lady with 6 children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and, at the same time, does farming. She faces challenges of defaulters. She has hopes of building a permanent house.

Margret needs a loan to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, and omo (detergent) to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, and omo (detergent) to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy used the previous loan to buy shoes to sell. Her main business is selling second-hand shoes and she also raises pigs to boost her income. She faces the challenges of customers not paying on time and seasonality of the business. Her dreams are to buy land and build a good house for her residence and expand her shoe business to new areas. Lucy intends to use the loan to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy land and build a house.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Rowena is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Jackies est une femme d’affaires, membre de la banque villageoise Confiance, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt du centre commercial de la ville depuis 29 ans. Son conjoint est un maçon. Elle va acheter de haricots, maïs et soja. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Jackies is an entrepreneur, a member of the Confiance ["Confidence"] banc villageois, and a client of the Hekima microfinance institution. She is married, 46 years old, and has six children, all of whom study. She launched her business with the funds received from her parents. She  has been selling food items from a warehouse in the commercial center of her town for 29 years. Her husband is a stonemason. Jackies is going to buy beans, corn and soy. She would like to keep taking out loans and be able to provide for her children's education, food and clothing. In conclusion, Jackie thanks Hekima for its support of small business owners who lack access to traditional banking services.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn and soy.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 38-year-old hardworking man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like rice to sell. He faces the  challenges of limited capital. However, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Rajab needs a loan to buy more cattle to raise.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to raise

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Elenita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Erma has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and lives in Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their school age. 

Letecia is engaged in plastic, scrap metal and other junk collecting activities, and has been for several years. She has been earning approximately PHP 3,200 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing a second-hand motorcycle to be used for business. Letecia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Letecia hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: Purchase 2nd hand Tri-cycle

loans.name: Carmen Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Mano De Dios.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 15, 14, 4, 3 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de agua.
Doña Carmen es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudar con los gastos que representan los estudios de sus hijos, ella en su casa tiene un deposito  de venta de agua en  bidones, entrega a domicilio y a ciertas tiendas de la  ciudad para esto le ayudan sus hijos y su marido cuando está desocupado de sus labores, su marido es el que lleva los productos directos de fabrica y le sale más barato por lo cual le quedan muy buenos ingresos. Lleva 4 años con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidones y en todas las variedades. Lleva 3 ciclos en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the group called "La Mano de Dios" (the hand of god) meets in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.

This is where Carmen lives. She is 30 years old and she is married. She has five children that are 15, 14, 4, 3, and 2 years old.  The two older children go to the local school.  Her husband works in a water treatment facility.

Carmen is a woman that has always enjoyed working in order to help pay the household expenses. She likes to support her children's education.  In her home she has a water tank and sells water in jugs. She provides the water to various households and to some stores in the city. This is how she helps support her children and husband. Her husband brings the water directly from the facility and they sell it for an affordable price, but it still earns them a good income.  They have done this work for 4 years.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy water jugs in many varieties. This is her third loan with this group and she likes the group because they help bring her the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy water jugs in many varieties.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 65 years old and a resident of Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of her house, and her neighbors are her clients. 

Since she is single and she support parents, she has decided to improve her small business to support their needs. So she has requested a loan at Paglaum MPC to purchase stock for the sari-sari store to increase sales. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for sari-sari store to increase sales

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Mano De Dios.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años. El marido es pintor.
Doña Diana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con os gastos ya que el no gana mucho en su labor,  ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a realizar sus recorridos en las horas que sabe que puede encontrar a sus clientes ya sea en la mañana o en las noches, deja a crédito esta mercadería y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva más de 3 años dedicada esta actividad la cual les sirve de mucho para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y  ropa. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "La Mano De Dios" meet every fifteen days in the municipal citadel of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind. This is where Diana lives. She is 21 years old and in a common-law relationship from which she has a three-year-old son. The husband is a painter.

Diana likes to work so that she can help her husband with the household expenses since he does not earn much from his work. She works selling catalog clothing and shoes. 

She sells door-to-door, making her rounds at the times when she knows she can find her customers, be it in the morning or at night. She sells the merchandise on credit and collects every eight or fifteen days. She has done this work for over three years and it has helped her greatly to get ahead with her family.

This loan is to buy shoes and clothes. Diana has been in the communal bank for five cycles, and she likes it because with the loans she gets ahead. 

Her dreams are to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Pio

texts.en: Pio is 33 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for ten years. He likes his profession. He also practices farming for additional income. He is an honest person faced with a challenge of a long distance from home to work. Pio requests a loan to buy cement and sand to build his house, in order to have improved standards of living.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to build his house

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, trabaja vendiendo dulces y cereales en el mercado de su ciudad natal, Parcona. En sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con sus pequeñas, es una madre amorosa que quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos porque más adelante espera verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
Carmen en esta oportunidad utilizará el crédito para poder comprar una computadora para sus hijos, para que puedan hacer sus trabajos del colegio y puedan distraerse en sus horas libres. Con esto su desempeño mejorará en sus estudios y así ella seguirá trabajando de manera tranquila para ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a mother in a very entrepreneurial family. She works selling candy and cereal in the market in Parcona. In her free time she likes to go out strolling with her children. She is a loving mother and wants to give the best to her children because in the future she hopes to see them become successful professionals.

Carmen is seeking a loan so that she can buy a computer for her children. She wants them to be able to use a computer for their school work and to entertain themselves with it in their free time. This will help them improve their studies and she can continue working without distraction in order to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Agnes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and fattening pigs. Agnes is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Agnes has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en:
Sahil is married. He is 28 years old and has a child. Sahil’s family is IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fizuli city. For the past 22 years, they have lived in the Hokmanli settlement of Baki region.

Sahil is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between different areas of Baki region. Now Sahil wants to repair his car. He wants to buy new tires for the car because winter is coming. For this reason he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. Sahil is thankful to Kiva for the aid.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong would like to take an additional loan to buy good quality food to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.
