She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality food to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as milk, sardines, candies, coffee, detergent, soap and other things to sell. Veronica opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $300. She is happy with the loan provided by Tuba Rai Metin. With this loan she hopes to improve her business management.

loans.use: to buy milk, sardines, candies, coffee, detergent, soap and other items.

loans.name: Areliza Ernestina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Areliza, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Areliza es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta con su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, prepara sus dulces para fiestas y compromisos sociales, por lo general todos los  fines de semana tiene estos contratos, ella también en su casa tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos los mismos que una vez que estén listos los vende a vecinos del lugar, con lo cual se gana algo extra que le sirven para salir adelante,  ella lleva más de 15 años dedicada a la fabricación de dulces lo cual le da para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho. 
Este crédito es para  comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos dulces y alimento para los pollos. Esta desde en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the group called “Salud y Progreso” (health and progress) meet in Tosagua. This town is known for being dynamic.  Most people that live here work in agriculture and in raising animals, as this is a region with great vegetation.

Areliza lives here. She is 64 years old, she is married, and she has six children that are now all adults. One of her children lives in her home. Her husband works in agriculture.

Areliza is a hard-working woman that strives to get ahead. She makes candies for parties and weddings. Generally, she has contracts to make her candies every weekend. She also has a small farm at her house and she raises chickens. When the chickens are ready, she sells them to her neighbors. This is how she makes extra money in order to get by. She has made candies for over 15 years, which is how the family gets by as her husband doesn't make much money.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy ingredients for her candies, and also to buy chicken food. She enjoys being a member of the group because the loans help out a lot. She dreams to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and also to buy chicken food.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a single mother of four children, one of whom attends school. She also takes care of additional family members . Ruth has a business making and selling handbags.  She has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more raw materials for making handbags. She works in her shop seven days a week and sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing price of raw materials. She aspires to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy material for making handbags.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза родилась в 1996 году в семье служащего. В 2003 году поступила в школу и в 2014 году успешно закончила. Затем в этом же году поступила в Педагогический Университет Таджикистана и в настоящее время является студенткой 1-го курса. Она активная, целеустремленная, участвует на всех молодежных студенческих мероприятиях. Среди студентов имеет хороший авторитет. Дилноза запрашивает займ для оплаты годового обучения. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Dilnoza was born in 1996 into the family of a civil servant. In 2003 she entered school and she graduated in 2014. In the same year she has enrolled at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan, where she is a first-year student. She is active and purposeful and participates in all the student activities. She is influential among her peers.

Dilnoza is requesting a loan to pay her tuition. She hopes for your help and charity.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 54 years old and has three children. She provides catering services for any occasion and offers gowns for hire within the local community. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to earn sufficient income. 

Marlene wants to acquire the additional materials that she needs to provide catering services but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 50,000. Marlene will use the loan to buy more gowns to hire and kitchen utensils to provide catering services. 

Being patient and a hard-working mother, Marlene believes that some day, she will further improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more gowns to hire and kitchen utensils to provide catering services

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en: In 2000, Grecilda learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. Grecilda tried her luck on farming activities. She is thankful to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Grecilda borrowed an amount to pay for fertilizer to grow rice. This will help to boost her farming income. Grecilda looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en: Nicolasa is a hardworking mother from Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is 58 years old and is married. Nicolasa and her husband raise their family together. Nicolasa has applied for a membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op.  Nicolasa is in need of additional capital to purchase raw ingredients to increase pan bisaya (bread) for more customers. She requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 14,000 and is thankful for the financing. In addition, she wanted to expand her business for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for "pan bisaya" (bread).

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
For three years, Josephat, a 38-year-old married father of six living in Kasese, Uganda, has been selling cassava flour to earn a living to look after his family. He also operates a motorcycle transport business and farms to supplement his income.

Josephat has requested a loan to buy cassava flour to resell. Hardworking, he dreams of educating his children and becoming prosperous.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to resell

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.ru: Шохруху 18 год. Он успешный студент. Шохрух учится на 1 курсе Национального Университета Таджикистана по специальности Экономика и менеджмент. Он очень способный молодой человек и планирует стать будущим хорошим специалистом, но сели он не заплатит за учебный договор, то его будут исключать с университета. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shohruh is 18 years old and an outstanding first-year student at the National University of Tajikistan, where he is studying economics and management.  He is a very capable young man who is planning to be a good future university graduate, but unless he pays his university tuition, he will be expelled from the university.  He is taking a loan to pay his tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Joemin-Ann

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Joemin-ann has engaged in hog-raising to earn additional income. She is 33 years old and blessed with six children. She wants to make this business profitable in order to help her husband finance the education of her children and to sustain their daily necessities. She wants to acquire more pigs to raise but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She hopes to receive a loan to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs.

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with six children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for six years.  She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Betty’s monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора студентка 3 курса. Она учится в Таджикском  Национальном Университете. Она учится на отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Гулнора учится по специальности юриста и является секретарем студенческого Совета, а также получает стипендию. В будущем она хочет стать хорошим специалистом. Она запрашивает займ  для оплаты учебного договора в 2014-2015 учебного года. Так как ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу Гулноры, она обратилась в ИМОН за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora is a third-year student at Tajik National University. She gets excellent grades and actively participates in university social activities. She is majoring in law and is the secretary of the student council and receives a stipend. In the future she wants to have a successful career in her field. She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition for the 2014-2015 school year. Since her parents are unable to pay it, she has turned to IMON for a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 60 years old and lives in Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For five years now she has been selling bananas to earn a living. 

Rosario, a member of PMPC for 3 years, has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy processed and frozen food products needed for her business

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek, a 25 year-old-single man, lives with his family in Haja, Yemen. Tarek, whose family is poor, has a university education, but due to high rates of  unemployment in the country, he couldn't find a job to look after his family. A very dynamic and respected man, he has refused to surrender to that condition and decided to work raising and selling goats to provide for his family.

For this reason, Tarek has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase goats to raise and sell. He looks forward to increasing his business by opening a large farm to raise the goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa lives in Kampala. She is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She has two additional family members. Theresa lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.  

Theresa is a poultry farmer, operating her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past 21 years and works seven days a week. She earns additional income from making crafts .

Theresa has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy chickens, poultry feed, vaccines and feeding trays. Her business challenges include the changing price of poultry feed and poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations are to build more poultry houses.

loans.use: to buy chickens, poultry vaccines, feed and feeding trays

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel owns and operates a variety store to earn a living. She has been successful in this enterprise for years, and repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds other ways to improve her income to sustain the immediate needs of her family.

Isabel would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory and so is requesting an amount of PHP 40,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages. She also plans to open a new stall to sell a variety of cellphone accessories and other related items. She looks forward to this assistance in advance.

In the future, Isabel plans to expand and open branches in other areas of her community. She also hopes for good health for her family. Isabel meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, meets each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the tyres on his skid-steer loader.

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: Buhendwa est une femme ambitieuse, membre du groupe de crédits Esperance, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un électronicien, âgée de 47 ans et mère de 7 enfants, 3 scolarisés, 3 mariés et 1 n’étudie plus. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de la tontine. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans le marché du centre ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va acheter 250 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite renforcer son capital, nourrir et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Buhendwa is an ambitious person. She is a member of the Esperance ["Hope"] borrowers' group and a client of the Hekima microfinance institution. She is 47 years old and has seven children: three are in school, three are already married, and one no longer in school. Buhendwa launched her business from the funds received from her "tontine" [a community savings group]. She has been selling used shoes at the central market of her town since her youth. She will buy 250 pairs of shoes. She would like to bolster her capital and provide for her children's food and education. In conclusion,  Buhendwa thanks Hekima for its support of small business owners who lack access to traditional banking services.

loans.use: to buy 250 pairs of shoes [for resale].

loans.name: Alimuhammad

texts.ru: Алимухаммад родился в 1995 году. Он честный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Алимухаммад учится в Аграрный Университет Таджикистана. Алимухаммад учится в факультете Бухгалтерия и финансы. Он учится на 2 курсе. Алимухаммад не женат и живет с родителями. Он живет за городом и каждый день приезжает в город в университет. Алимухаммад обратился за займом для того чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Alimuhammad was born in 1995. He is an honest and hard-working young man. He is a student at the State Agrarian University of Tajikistan, majoring in accounting and finance. He is in his second year of studies. ALimhummad is single and lives with his parents. He lives in the suburbs and commutes to the city every day. Alimuhammad has applied for a loan in order to pay his tuition. He is counting on your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka's previous loan has expanded her business, making her earn more profit. She really appreciates it. She is still eager to expand her business.

With the Kes 20,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Sartichala village. She has six family members and they run an agricultural activity. In particular, lamze takes care of a milk cow, produce, cheese, and yogurt. She uses it for local trading. Iamze's husband also has seasonal income from truck service and generates 200 GEL monthly. This hardworking woman also works at the local kindergarten and has a small income from this activity.

To increase the family's living conditions and tackle financial difficulties, Iamze decided to open a general store locally. She needs financial support to purchase needed stock and to open a store at the place she already founded.

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase products to open a general store.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Ее муж таксист. Адолат работает в больнице. Она врач-гинеколог. Адолат работает в больнице более 10 лет. Она имеет большой опыт в сфере медицины. Она отлично выполняет свою работу. Адолат всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети как она сама были высококвалифицированными специалистами. Она обратилась за займом для того чтобы оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Ее сын является студентом первого курса. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Adolat is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Adolat herself has been working in a hospital for more than ten years. She is a gynecologist, with a great deal of experience in the field of medicine, and she does an excellent job.  Adolat's dream has always been to see her children become highly qualified university graduates, just like her.  She is taking a loan in order to pay tuition fees for her son who is a first-year student.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en: Lory is married with five children. She is 46 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. Lory is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and compost. Lory has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lory hopes to harvest more palay and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and compost

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en: Emmalyn is 34 years old and married with two kids. She is a resident of Balabag Gulayon Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte Phil. In 2010, she became a member of the Cooperative and enjoys the programs and services that the Cooperative offered. Recently, Emmalyn decided to apply for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase piglets and rice fertilizer. With the help of Paglaum MPC, Emmalyn wishes to expand her business and invest in another business venture.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and rice fertilizer

location.town: Dipolog-Gulayon, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is 30 years old and married with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Johnson operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for 10 years. He began the business to generate income for his family. Johnson has a dream of having a very successful business. Johnson wants money to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as glue, balm, sardines, cooking oils, candles, batteries, noodles, biscuits, candies, toothpaste, aqua and other things to sell including soft drinks. She started to do this business in 2011 with her own working capital of $250. Maria is earning a good income every day because many people come to buy, so she is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business and to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy glue, balm, sardines, cooking oils, candles, batteries,  noodles, biscuits, candies, toothpaste, aqua, soft drinks and other things to sell

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine is a 46-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Puntod, Lopez JAena, Misamis Occidental, industriously caring for her fish vending business.  She is married and has 7 children.  She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. 

The business is doing well. Elaine has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now Elaine sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 20,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy more fish for resale to be able to increase sales. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale to increase sales

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Rosa en las noches instala una carreta en las afueras de su casa en la cual vende comida, prepara arroz con menestra y carne asada, tiene muchos clientes que todas las noches visitan su local, su hija le ayuda con esta labor, son más de 10 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante sola.
 Está repitiendo el crédito ya es la única forma que ella tiene para poder financiar su negocio, gracias a sus ganancias ella tiene para sus gastos diarios. Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the communal bank Salud y Progreso meets in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its population make a living in agriculture and raising livestock since it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Rosa, who is 65 years old, lives in this area. Her husband passed away some years ago leaving her widowed, but she has five independent adult children from their marriage.

In the evenings, Rosa sets up a cart outside her home to sell food. She makes rice stew and roasted meat. She has a lot of customers who visit her business every night. Her daughter helps her with this work. She has had this business for over ten years and it is what allows her to move forward on her own.

She is requesting another loan since it is the only way for her to be able to finance her business. Thanks to her earnings, she has enough to cover her daily expenses. She will use this loan to buy rice, meat and other food for the preparation of her dishes. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for five years, and she likes it because the loans help her immensely. Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 47 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19 year old, single man, living with his family in their own house in one of Hodeidah's villages, Yemen. He studied until the Elementary school, but he couldn't complete his studies. He is a very dynamic and vigorous man. 

Ali and his family live in a very small, old house that needs to be expanded and renovated. Ali and his family strives to make the renovations and expansion, but they don't have enough money. As a result, Ali is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, wood, and bricks in order to make the necessary renovatsions To the house.

Ali's dream in the future is building more of one floor and renovating them. He hopes to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials as cement, wood, and bricks to renovate the house.

loans.name: Jeanet

texts.en:
Jeanet, age 30, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with two kids, and her husband is a wage earner but has no permanent work. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. 

Jeanet keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as a family they will sustain and beat the competition. 

She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy merchandise for the store to increase stock and serve more customers. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, and from there to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari (small grocery store) to serve more customers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her family's home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, thanks to her loan of 20,000 PHP. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Virginia has been given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. She was thankful when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to provide a safe and decent living space for the family

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Lea has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she took a loan to  purchase bags of feed for growing hogs to increase her income to support her family's needs. 

Lea wishes to continuue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds for growing hogs.

loans.name: Cesar Nervardo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive el señor Cesar, tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero pero tiene dos hijos de 9  y 8 años de edad, ambos estudian  en escuela, el vive en la casa de sus padres. 
Don Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador que lucha día a día para darle a sus hijos lo necesario para salir adelante, el vende ropa de  todo tipo, para realizar sus ventas  recorre la ciudad  ofreciendo  sus productos a conocidos y amigos del sector los cuales ya son sus clientes, el entrega la mercadería a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a como prefieran sus clientes. Lleva 1 año dedicado a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos él ha podido financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Salud y Progreso Communal Bank meets every fortnight. This place is know for being dynamic, the majority of its residents work in farming and animal husbandry as it is an area with abundant vegetation.

This is the place where Cesar lives, 37 years old, single but with two children of 9 and 8 years old, both go to school, he lives in his parents' house.

Cesar is a very hardworking man who struggles from day to day to give his children what they need to make it through. He sells clothing of all types, to make his sales he walks through the city offering his products to contacts and friends from the neighbourhood who are already his customers. He leaves the merchandise on credit and charges weekly or fortnightly, according to his customers' preferences. He has been in this business for a year, which is getting him through.

This loan is to buy clothing of all types. He has been in the communal bank for two years and he likes it because through the loans he has been able to finance his business. His dreams are to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Eighteen years ago Rael started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kipsembwo, a remote village in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Rael believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Rael waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 48 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children now at their adult age. 

For her source of living, Caroline has engaged in managing her sari-sari store business for 10 years already. She is also engaged in a chainsaw operating business. She earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity to help her husband in providing for their family needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for retail.  Caroline has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Caroline hopes to expand her sari-sari store and chainsaw operating business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Yecenia Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Yecenia, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  11 años  de edad, el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposo es empleado público.
Doña Yecenia como varias personas del cantón se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, ella le da forma y sabor a sus dulces para que sean degustado por las personas de su ciudad y de otras donde se venden sus dulces, son muchos los clientes que ella tiene y que le piden que les prepare los dulces ya sea para llevarlos a vender o para fiestas y compromisos sociales, lo cual por lo general es los  fines de semana que tiene estos contratos,  lleva 3 años dedicada a esta labor la misma que aprendió de su mamá. 
Este crédito es para  comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos dulces. Lleva 1 año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Salud y Progreso" meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua which is known for being a very dynamic area. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal breeding because it is an area of lush vegetation. This is where Yecenia lives. She is 40 years old, is married, and she has an 11-year-old son who is in school. Her husband is a public servant.

Yecenia, like several people in the district, makes a living preparing and selling homemade pastries. She elaborates them using shapes and flavors to be enjoyed by the people in her own town and other towns where her pastries are sold.

She has many clients asking her to make her pastries and go sell them, or to fill orders for parties and social engagements. Usually she has orders to fill on weekends. For three years now she has done this work which she learned from her mother.

This loan is to buy supplies to make her delicious pastries. Yecenia has been in the communal bank for a year and she likes it because the loans carry very low interest rates.

Her dreams are to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: put in a bathroom, finish the installation of a drain and install a toilet in her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan has always dreamed of opening his own painting shop to support his children and give them a brighter future. 

He used his loan to buy paintings to sell to his customers. Juan was always out in the streets selling his paintings for some money. 

He is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more paintings to increase stock and sales.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Maressa

texts.en:
Maressa is managing her eatery business in Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This business has been doing well supporting the needs of the family.

Maressa has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed PHP 7,000 to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery for more viands to serve and to attract more customers. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices so she can serve more viands to attract customers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is from Tipolo, Plaridel. She is 50 years old, married and has the eagerness and expertise in selling. 

She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meagre income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Corazon is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to ensure a continuous income to support the family needs. Corazon is looking forward to better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to repair and renovate his old house.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is 36 years old. She lives in the village of Sevkar in the Tavush region with her big family: She lives with her husband, three children (all of them are school-age) and her mother-in-law (she is a pensioner). Zhanna is already a skilled and successful farmer; she has been working since a very young age together with her husband. Zhanna’s husband has a truck, and he does cargo transfers around the region with it. Zhanna says farming and agriculture are first place for her family since that is the only constant source of income for them. 

On her farm, Zhanna takes care of four cows, a pig and twenty chickens. She sells a lot of milk and eggs and also some meat from her farm. Her fruit garden gives a good harvest of apples, persimmons, figs and peaches during the season, which she sells to a reseller from her house. Zhanna will be greatly happy to receive this loan, which will help her to buy one more cow and two calves. It will make her farm richer and her family income bigger.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and two calves

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina, who is in her late 30's, is a widow with two children who are still at school.  She has been selling fruits, vegetables and cassava for seven years now.  She works from 5 am until 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Zaina's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the genge (grocery store) stock and started selling cassava.  She has successfully paid back all her loans.  She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, built her house and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and cassava.  She dreams of improving her business.  

Zaina will make sure that she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is 51 years of age and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. They have a little fishing business from which they earn a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. Gertrudes and her husband work hard selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested a PHP 20,000 loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase new nets, foams and other fishing accessories to increase their fish catch and ability to sell more. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Gertrudes smiles at the thought of seeing her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Edie

texts.en:
Edie is driven by his passion for selling. At the age of 48, he is married and lives in Plaridel.

Edie runs a store that primarily supports his family. He never get tired of tending his store. Edie is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. He religiously paid his obligations without any records of default.

He has now requested another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and soft drinks to increase stock for more sales. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil,  and noodles

loans.name: Acelita

texts.en:
Acelita, 60, is a widow with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs.

Acelita is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of the franchise agreement/permit so she could continue her business operation.

In the future, Marites wants to buy another tricycle unit for business purposes. She hopes to improve their general living conditions and to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Efrina

texts.en:
Efrina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Efrina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more herbal medicines to sell to her customers.

Efrina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicines to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Olga Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Olga, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Olga se dedica al comercio, en su casa vende  leche, queso, maní molido y varios productos más, ella compra el queso y la leche de agricultores de la zona, tiene muchos clientes que le comprar sus productos muy necesarios en el diario vivir, lleva más de 20 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como pueden financiar su negocio, gracias a sus ganancias ella ha podido salir adelante. Este crédito es para comprar leche y quesos para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Cristobal Communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This place is known to be very dynamic, where the majority of its inhabitants are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone with a lot of vegetation.

This is the place where Olga, she is 56 years old, married, she has five children from this relationship, all are of age and independent. Her husband is a farmer.

Olga works in business, from her house she sells milk, cheese, ground peanuts and other assorted products. She buys cheese and milk from farmers in the area, she has a lot of customers who buy her products which are very necessary for daily life. She has been in this business for 20 years which allows her to get through.

She is getting another loan as this is how she can finance her business, thanks to her earnings she has been able to get ahead. This loan is to buy milk and cheeses for sale. She has been in the communal bank since the start and she likes it because the loans are very necessary for her business. Her dreams is to come out ahead.

loans.use: to purchase milk and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza city. His father works as an employee in a local bank. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad is a student, and is in his last year of studying accounting. He would like to obtain his BA degree and find a job in the future. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to write his reports and home work easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Everiza

texts.en: Everiza is 30 years old and married. She was gifted with two children and they live happily in a rural community. She engages in cooking and selling snack foods and coffee to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to acquire the materials needed in preparing snacks but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 20,000.00 to a buy coffee stand, a microwave oven, a casserole set, grocery items and ingredients she nees to cook and sell. She is hoping that she will avail her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy a coffee stand, a microwave oven, a casserole set, grocery items and ingredients.

loans.name: Emelynda

texts.en:
Emelynda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, juice, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Emelynda has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending.

Emelynda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, juice, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like dresses, blouses, slippers, t-shirts, etc. to sell in her business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods like dresses, blouses, slippers, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 33 year old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a farmer and at the same time rides a motorcycle to boost his income. He faces challenges of limited capital, besides that, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Wilson needs a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
Zebiniso is 23 years old, single, and lives with parents. She is a highly educated woman. 

Zebiniso works in a school as a teacher of Russian language. She gets a small salary, but it is not enough for living. So, she is going to start a new business to get a new source of income. She is going to start business of raising animals. Zebiniso took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ run by a woman's organization with this aim and got useful information for herself. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cattle to start her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en: To combat the hardships of living, Perlita has been engaged in a hog raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 48 years old and blessed with only one child. She aims to make her business viable and profitable, but she lacks capital. For this reason, she would like to take out a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Through hard work and strong determination, she hopes that she will improve her business and their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor owns and operates a tricycle unit. He has been in this business for many years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. He is requesting an amount of PHP 19,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of his franchise agreement / permit so he can continue his business operation.

Redentor still desires to buy another tricycle for business purposes. He also wants to become successful in life in the years to come. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.* 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of a tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 42, is married with three school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 11 years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is very eager to continue the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to serve more customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mary, a youthful 78-year-old shosho (old mum), a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Githirioni, a remote village in Thika. She is happily married and is blessed with five adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained so much experience. 

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Thika area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Mary feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 adult children.

Cristina has been engaged in agri-business, particularly coconut production, for 5 years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month through this bisuness. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Cristina hopes to acquire additional parcels of cocoland.

loans.use: to purchasing construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 64 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependent. 

She has been engaged in operating a sari-sari store business for 14 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Julia has been a member of PMPC for almost ten years. In the future, Julia hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 51 years old and lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 7 children of whom 6 are now adults and one is still school-aged. Jovita is engaged in managing an auto and electrical shop together with her husband as the repairman. They have had this business for 15 years and earn approximately PHP 4,000 each month through this business.

Jovita has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional materials, equipment and other accessories for their auto and electrical shop business to improve services. Jovita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Jovita hopes to expand their auto and electrical shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, equipment and other accessories for her auto and electrical shop.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 39 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at infant age. 

She has engaged in hog fattening, hog raising, and operating a sari-sari store business for ten years already. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing these types of business activities. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing piglets, as well as five sacks of booster and five sacks of grower feeds for her hog fattening and raising business.
 
Meriam has been a member of PMPC for almost 12 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog fattening and hog raising business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing piglets, as weill as five sacks of booster and five sacks of grower feeds

loans.name: Florenita

texts.en:
Florenita has signed up for her membership with PMPC and acquired the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital  extended to a small time borrower like her. 

She is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she acquired a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to increase inventories and raise more income for the benefit of the family. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for them.

loans.use: to restock additional basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, noodles, eggs, and soft drinks to increase inventories

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Alois

texts.en:
Alois has a retail shop in Emali town and has been running this business for ten years now. He is 30 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of milk and a fridge for storing soft drinks, juice and milk. Alois will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk and a fridge.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with five adult-age children. 

She is gaining a profit in her retailing business. She buys coconuts for copra from her neighbors and sells them in bulk in the market where she can fetch higher prices. She has had this business for 22 years and has supported her family, especially her children's education, until they got jobs in their own.  

She requested a loan to purchase more inventories of coconuts for copra to sell more and pay for her husband's health needs. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, she hopes to own a space near in town so that she can cater to more customers from different barangays for a good business opportunity.
             .

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of coconuts for copra

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 57 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has six adult children.
 
Elma has been operating a hog raising business for five years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month from this business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two piglets, one sack of booster feed and one sack of rice bran for her hog raising business. 

Elma has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Elma hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and some pig-feed for her business.

loans.name: Nancy Ondina Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 51 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Nancy realiza el crédito para su esposo y para ella, el marido se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, el en una granja de localidad compra los pollos al por mayor y luego los lleva a un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende los pollos enteros o por libras. Ella prepara deliciosos almuerzos bajo pedido de sus clientes, entrega a domicilio.  De esta forma se gana su sustento diario.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como pueden financiar su negocio y así salir adelante, sus ganancias son para los gastos que genera el hogar. Este crédito es para comprar pollos y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 17 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos empezó su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the San Cristóbal loan group meets every two weeks. The area is known for being very dynamic. The majority of the inhabitants are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals because this area has a lot of vegetation. 
Nancy lives in this area. She is 51 years old. She is married and she has three older children. One of the children lives in her home. Her husband is a businessman. 
Nancy is requesting the loan for her husband and herself. Her husband buys and sells chickens. He buys the chickens in bulk at a local farm. Later, he takes them to a rented location in the center of the city where he sells whole chickens or by the pound. She prepares delicious lunches by request and makes home deliveries. This earns them a daily livelihood. 
She is repeating the request for a loan so that they can finance their business and come out ahead. Their earnings are for the household expenses. This loan is for the purchase of chickens and supplies to prepare food. She has been involved with the credit group for 17 years. She likes that the loans started her business that today allows her to earn something on her own. Her dream is that Nancy and her family will have good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Perly

texts.en:
This is Perly. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy spare parts, accessories and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Perly wants to progress and become more successful both in business and in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle.

loans.name: Mukama Mwesigwa Group

texts.en:
Jane is a first time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) applying for a loan through the group. She sells matooke (green bananas)--a local delicacy--in one of the markets. The purpose of the loan is to boost her makooke business. Her customers are well-wishers and neighbors. She is honest and hard working. She has been able to look after her children and also other family members from this business in boarding schools and also provide all the basic needs for them.

Her dream is to see that her children study and have a bright future. She is so greatful for the support given to her as single mother.

loans.use: to buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is driven by passion for selling. She  is 63 years old,  a mother of five children in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, and she runs a store that primarily supports for their family. Every day she never gets tired of tending her store. 

She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to restock items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to sell and attract more customers. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities.

In the future, Pacita dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to sell and attract more customers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a businesswoman from Lopez Jaena. She is 31 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Roselyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items which will increase sales to support her kids' needs.

Roselyn continues to look for better business opportunities - proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old,married and together with her spouse they have 3 children. She has a food supply business and a retail shop for selling household items. She has been in this business for the past 5 years.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of milk, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking oil for use in her food supply business, allowing her to be able to supply more food and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful, make more income, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a toilet pipe and build her own drain.

loans.name: Jay Ann

texts.en:
Jay Ann, who recently joined Paglaum MPC, she is married and has 2 infant-age children. She and her husband engag in farming activities to earn a living and to sustain their family. As a farmer, Jay Ann experienced hardship. She finds herself plowing the farm land and planting vegetables and agricultural commodities like root crops. In farming, she earns PHP 3,000 a month--just enough for their needs. She tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Jay Ann feels that she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as working capital.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her next crop, to have a more productive corn harvest. Jay Ann wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the next crop to have a more productive corn harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for garlic, different spices, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has an ice cream-selling business in Emali town and has been running this business for three years now. She is 32 years old and married, and she and her spouse together have been blessed with two children.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of  for sugar, food coloring, milk and other food items for making ice cream to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to have a prosperous business and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To buy sugar and milk for making ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is driven by her passion for selling. At the age of 56 and a mother of five children in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. She never get tired tending her store. Lydia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. She is now requesting another loan to restock items for her sari-sari (Small Grocery) store to sell and attract more customers. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to sell and attract more customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. She is grateful for the loan assistance extended to her as she was able to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen wants to buy another jeepney for transportation service so he could increase her income. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to achieve part of his dream.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 23 years old. She is known in their neighborhood for her snack vending business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers.

She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and wood for a durable and comfortable living space for the family. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and wood for her house to provide a durable and comfortable living space for the family.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Hello lenders, the above picture presents Risper, 26 years of age: a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Kenyenya. It is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has two lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet.

Risper is a tough woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Kenyenya area has conditions that favor dairy farming and Risper has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10-20 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Kapsowar area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Risper is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow her to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a bio gas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: To buy a quality exotic breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Lorena Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lorena, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene una  hija de 3 años de edad, la cual es su compañía. 
Doña Lorena es una gran madre que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su hija, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, zapatos, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana allí mismo deja y cobra  ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y sabanas. Ella lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la puntualidad de los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The San Cristobal Communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This place is known to be very dynamic, where the majority of its inhabitants are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone with a lot of vegetation.

This is where Lorena lives, 27 years old, a single mother with a daughter of 3 years old, who is her company. Lorena is a great mother who struggles daily to raise her daughter. She works in business, she sells clothing of all types, sheets, duvets, shoes, etc. She does her sales from door to door, she does her runs four days a week where she leaves her products on credit and charges every week. She has been working this job for more than 10 years with which gets ahead.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes and sheets. She has been in this communal bank for 9 years and she likes it because of the punctuality of the loans. Her dreams are to give the best to her little daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and sheets.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a 40 year old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time works as a hawker. He faces challenges of limited capital and weather changes, however he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. He will use the loan to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 62 years old with six children. Rosa personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC almost 3 years ago, she has been a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 5,000 for the purchase of new nets.  The needed fishing accessories minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase of new nets to increase her fish catch.

loans.name: Veverly

texts.en:
This is Veverly. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Veverly hopes that her business will continue to operate and will help provide to their everyday needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Yuster

texts.en: Yuster is a 36 year old lady living in Fort Portal Uganda. She does farming alongside running a hotel. She faces challenges of limited capital. She has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. Yuster needs a loan to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for planting

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. This loan is intended to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles and eggs to increase stock and raise more income for the benefit of her family. Petrona dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from of her business.
