loans.use: to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, and eggs to increase stock and raise more income.

loans.name: Magdalia

texts.es:
Magdalia es una trabajadora mujer que a partir de 2 ciclos de pago que tuvo con la corporación interactuar ha podido crecer su negocio de confección directa, actividad que ha ejercido durante 6 años y dichos créditos los ha pagado puntualmente. 
Magdalia inicio su negocio buscando ser una ayuda para su familia generar ingresos, mejorar la calidad de vida, su alimentación, la educación de los pequeños etc.
Magdalia quiere solicitar un crédito para seguir con su negocio de confección directa y su idea es seguir creciendo por esta razón con el crédito comprara una maquina fileteadora, maquina colladora e insumos como telas para seguir con su profesión y seguir creciendo. 
Este crédito le permitirá agilizar sus procesos de confección y pensar en contratar madres cabezas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Magdalia is a hardworking woman, who within two payment cycles with Interactuar, has been able to grow her dressmaking business.  She has been doing this work for 6 years, and she has paid off her loans on time.

Magdalia started her business in order to help her family generate income, improve their quality of life and food, and provide an education for the children, etc.

Magdalia wants to request a loan in order to continue with her dressmaking business, and her idea is to continue growing.  For this reason, she will use the loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine, a cloth cutting machine, and supplies such as fabric, in order to continue growing with her profession.

This loan will allow her to streamline her sewing processes, and think about hiring mothers who are heads of their households for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine, a cloth cutting machine, and supplies for making her garments.

loans.name: Marino

texts.en: Vegetable production is Marino's primary activity within his community. He is 38 years old, married but has no children yet. He aimed to improve their poor living status in order to give his family a better life. He planned to plant various vegetables for sale but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he wants to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed for vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Oyao, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlinda dreams of improving the general living condition of her family. She also desires to become a successful businesswoman someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God they study.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle units.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida requested a PHP 14,900 loan through PMPC to pay for labor in cultivating land for fruits and coconut.

Lida is 38 years old and has been in this business for five years now.  

Lida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and hopes in the future she can buy additional land for the extension of her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor in land cultivation.

loans.name: Ngasoma Road Group

texts.en:
ZAINABU, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been selling fresh and fried fish for one year now. She works from 5am to 3pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be ZAINABU's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish and meet her customer demand. She dreams of adding more rooms onto her two-room house.

ZAINABU will share this loan with her loan group "NGASOMA ROAD'  which consist of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: increase her stock of fish and meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is 54 years old, married and has three children. 

Aida has a shop that sells beauty products for men and women, such as soap, lotion, perfume and other things. She has had this business for five years, and she finds it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her sales talk.

She has requested a loan to purchase more stock so can offer more to her customers. Expanding her inventory would also mean an increase to her income. Aida has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock so she can offer more to her customers.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 48 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. He has a welding shop in Machakos town where he makes metal door frames and window panes to sell. Martin has been in this business for the past ten years. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more welding materials for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is Martin's first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business by opening more welding shops and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina has a business selling tupperware products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now. 

Erwina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of tupperware products to sell to her customers.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tupperware products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of a franchise agreement / permit so she can continue her business operation. She also operates a variety store and she will use a portion of the loan to buy grocery items needed to expand her inventory.

In the future, Maricel wants her transportation business to continue flourishing. She also hopes to give her children a better future through giving them good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 43 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Merlina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlina has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette, age 42, is married with three children between 12 and 18 years old, and all of them go school. She has been selling foodstuffs for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize flour and sorghum. The profit from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize flour and sorghum.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single Syrian refugee who left his family in Syria and moved two years ago to Lebanon searching for a safe place with a better income to support his family in Syria during the harsh war.

Mohammad has been employed selling clothes in a shop for two years with a limited income, which he invests in covering his living needs and sending part to his family in Syria. Because of this, he can’t save any extra money for his future use. Thus,  today Mohammad is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s  field partner Al Majmoua to send to his family in Syria to prepare themselves for the upcoming winter season by buying a heater to keep them warm, in addition to storing necessary Mouneh (conserved food) to eat during this season.

He hopes to increase his income, which will allow him to satisfy the needs and expenses of his beloved family.

loans.use: To send money to his family in Syria to buy a heater

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 40-year-old lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and has been in business for a period of seven years. Margret has requested a loan to buy stock of sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

Margret faces challenges of defaulters.

She has hopes of buying a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Fe is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 38-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing tomatoes and selling beans and maize. He faces challenges of limited capital, but besides that, he has hopes of improving on his income. Christopher needs a loan to buy herbicides for spraying tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for spraying tomatoes.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is 24 years old. She is married and has two little children. Her husband is in Russia. He is a rental worker. One year ago, Madina began work as a seller in a shop but her salary is small and it is not enough for her living expenses. Now, Madina is going to start her own business deal by selling dishes. She will sell dishes in a local market. Madina will manage the business alone. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy dishes for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy dishes for organizing her new business

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: "Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean that people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Rahab, a 42-year-old mixed farmer based in Githunguri, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. This charming mother of four has been engaged in mixed farming for the past two years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, milk, tea, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Thika. Rahab has a good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Rahab will achieve their dreams and goals. Rahab believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine, 50 years old, is married with four children between 10 and 20 years old, three of whom go to school. She has been selling clothes for the past seven years. With the loan; she would like to buy more clothes. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa is 28 years old. She is a kind woman who works hard for the well-being of her family. Zarifa is married and brings up a son. Her son is a little boy. 

Zarifa is going to organize a business with growing agriculture products. She has 2 hectares of land. She will grow crops and sell in a local market. Zarifa took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,400 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to grow crops for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to grow crops for organizing a new business

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy, together with his wife Jean, owns and operates a tailoring business to earn a living. He has been successful in this business for years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds other ways to improve his income so he can sustain their everyday needs and expenditures.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to buy raw materials needed to improve their service. He is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy more quantities of thread, fabric and other materials needed for tailoring.

In the future, Sandy wants to make improvements to their business and give his family a better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. He finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like thread, fabric and other things needed in his tailoring business.

loans.name: Meli

texts.en:
Meli is 42 years old, married and together with her spouse, has have been blessed with five children. She has a retail business and she is also a farmer. She has been in these businesses for 10 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of retail goods for sell. She will also buy a cow and increase her stock of livestock. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business, be financially stable and be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy retail goods and a cow

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 51 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Epifania works very hard to provide for them.

Epifania runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, shampoo, etc.

Epifania has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Epifania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Jennefer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennefer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, noodles, sugar, fabric conditioners, biscuits, juice, etc., to sell.

Jennefer has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, noodles, sugar, fabric conditioners, biscuits, juice, etc. 

In the future, Jennefer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cooking oil, noodles, sugar, fabric conditioners, biscuits, juice, etc., to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 65 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Merlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is 41 years old. She is married, and together with her husband, has been blessed with three children. Benedetta sells groceries, a business she has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 1,500 KES (Kenyan shillings).

Benedetta has requested her first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy different kinds of vegetables, including indigenous vegetables, for sale. Many of her customers love indigenous vegetables, therefore having such products will help boost her business.

With the anticipated profits, Benedetta will be able to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a family that is stable and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of vegetables, including indigenous ones, for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 56 years old and married with seven children between 18 and 32 years old, all of whom go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for six years. With the loan; she would like to buy more rice, beans, cassava and sorghum. The profit from the business will be used to buy more rice, beans and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, cassava and sorghum

loans.name: Bisdak Group

texts.en:
Maria Jelyn is the featured borrower of Bisdak group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their Philippine hometown to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Maria Jelyn is a 39-year-old married mother of five children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Since her income is limited, and her family’s living needs are increasing, Maria Jelyn has her own small business which she runs during her free time that has to do with selling prepaid mobile phones cards as an additional income business. Thus, today her acquired loan will be invested in supporting her business through increasing her business capital to increase her income. 

With respect to the other group members, Helen is a 49-year-old married mother of eight children, and Edna is a 32-year-old single lady, and they both want to send the acquired loan to their families in the Philippines.

Maria Jelyn is the first lady on the left, Helen is the lady standing in the middle, and Edna is first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to support her prepaid mobile phone cards business through increasing her business capital to increase her income

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John sells goats in Emali town and has been running this business for five years now. He is 55 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with 10 children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of goats for selling. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is his sixth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To buy more goats for selling.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 41 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Leonila has a wooden frames making and lamination business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Leonila has been in this business for 20 years. Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her frames business

loans.name: Carmen Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores  de edad, con ella viven dos de sus hijos y también una nieta de  4 años que es su adoración. 
Doña Carmen con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos por catálogos, además de bisuterías que compra a artesanos en otras ciudades,   su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Ella lleva 7  años con su negocio con el cual se ayuda para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, zapatos y bisuterías. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "San Cristóbal" loan group meets every fortnight in the city of Tosagua, a place known for its dynamism. Here the people work in farming and raising animals as the land is lush with vegetation.

And it is her that 43-year-old Carmen lives. She is a single mother to three children, now adults. Two of Carmen's children still live at home. Carmen also has one granddaughter, whom she loves dearly.

With an aim of earning some money on her own and being able to cover household costs, Carmen has a business. She sells clothes and shoes out of catalogues, as well as jewellery that she buys from artisan producers in other cities. Carmen sells door-to-door and out of her home, where her best customers come to see her. Carmen sells her items on credit, collecting payment once a week or every two weeks. Carmen has had the business for seven years and it has helped her to get ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, including shoes, clothes and jewellery. Carmen has been with the loan group since its inception and she likes it as the loans finance her business. Carmen's dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and jewellery.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. Agustina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Agustina has been in this business for 35 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is age 23 years. She is married with two children aged between 1 and 3; one of them goes to school. She has a foodstuffs business. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and cooking oil. 

The profit from the business will be used to improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and cooking oil.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 58 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age and one at his school age. 

For their income, Divina has been engaged in managing a hauling and trucking service, coconut lumber and wood dealing business for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of business activity. At present, she is also employed as a clerk of the court in one of the courts in this province. 

She has requested a loan to pay the real estate tax of their residential lot. The remaining amount is for the repair and maintenance of their delivery truck. Divina has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Divina hopes to expand her coconut lumber and wood dealing business.

loans.use: To pay the real estate tax of their residential lot

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: La señora Teodolinda vive en Tiraque, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, pero vive en concubinato, tiene tres pequeños hijos que dependen de ellos económicamente, se dedica a la fabricación de colchones de paja y también a la agricultura, siembran en terrenos de su madre, tienen experiencia en ambos rubros,  además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 4 toros que les sirven para sus trabajos de agricultura.  La señora Teodolinda requiere un crédito para la compra de abono, insumos agrícolas y compra de una cortadora de pasto para seguir fabricando colchones de paja, ya que el ahorro que tenía lo invirtió en la construcción de su propia casa, de esta forma lograra mejorar sus ingresos económicos para el bien de su familia a futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Teodolinda is 20 years old and lives in Tiraque. She is single, but is in a relationship. Teodolinda has three small children who are financially dependent on her. She makes straw mattresses and also engages in agriculture by cultivating her mother’s land. Teodolinda has experience in both trades. In addition, she has four bulls that are used for the farm work.

Sra. Teodolinda needs a loan in order to buy compost, farming supplies, and a straw cutter that will help her to continue making mattresses. The savings that she has will be invested in the construction of her house, so the loan will help to improve her earnings. This will allow her to provide for her family’s welfare in the future.

loans.use: to buy compost, farming supplies, and a straw cutter.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 7, 6 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y dos en escuela. El marido es artesano. 
Doña Ana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones, zapatos, productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale dos a tres días por semana en las mañanas, aprovecha que sus hijos están en su escuela y se le hace más fácil salir, también vende en su casa lugar hasta el cual llegan sus clientes. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, sabanas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Ella lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the San Cristobal Credit Group meets every fifteen days. This place is known for being very dynamic, a place where most of its inhabitants earn their livings through agriculture and animal husbandry, because it is an area with a great deal of vegetation. Ana lives in this place.  She is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has four children, ages 12, 7, 6 and 2 years old. The oldest is in middle school and two are in elementary school. Her husband is a craftsman.

Ana is a housewife who, in order to get herself her own resources to help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothes, blankets, sheets, shoes, and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and accessories for ladies). Her sales method is selling door to door.  She leaves two to three days per week in the mornings, taking advantage of the fact that her children are at school which makes it easier to get out.  She also sells at her home, which customers visit. She has earned her living this way for more than 10 years, by which she has gotten ahead.  This loan is to buy shoes, linens, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been in the Credit Group for six years and she likes it because of the help provided by the loans. Her dreams are to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy shoes, linens, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Alfredo Esau

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Alfredo trabaja en una fabrica cercana a su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma junto a su esposa llevan el sustento a su hogar. Alfredo desea instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión del servicio lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 29 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and their five-year-old daughter. He has been working at a factory near his town for quite some time. This job helps him and his wife to sustain their household.

Alfredo wants to install electricity for his home, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the connection so that he can receive service as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity services for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Bibiroila

texts.ru: 53-летняя Бибироила начинает новый бизнес в сфере услуг. Она по профессии пекарь и повар, поэтому теперь хочет развиваться в этом направлении и построить свой бизнес. Бибироила в парке культуры и отдыха своего района Шахритус взяла в аренду одно помещение и собирается открыть там столовую. За аренду она будет платить каждый месяц около 100 долларов. Сейчас у нее на руках остались сбережения в размере около 300 долларов США. Для открытия столовой ей еще не хватает 1500 долларов и эту сумму она берет в кредит. Бибироила собирается купить на эти суммы большую электрическую плиту и продукты для готовки блюд. Для начала ее меню блюд будет состоять из 4 национальных блюд, но затем она намерена расширить свое меню. Бибироила очень надеется, что Вы поддержите ее в осуществлении ее цели.
texts.en:
53 year old Bibiroila is starting a new business in the service industry.  Her professional training is as a cook and baker, and she wants to further herself and start a business in this field.  She is getting ready to open a café in a premises she has rented in her native Shahrituz region's main recreational and amusement park.  She will be paying about $100 (USD) per month in rent.  

Right now, Bibiroila has about $300 left in savings, but to open the café she needs another $1,500 and she has applied for a loan in this amount. Bibiroila is going to use this money to buy a large electric range and food supplies for preparing meals.  To start, her menu will consist of four traditional dishes, but Bibiroila plans to expand it in the future.  Bibiroila really hopes that you will support her in achieving her goal.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and an electric range for her new café

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica a la venta de haba cocida(mote de haba), vende a los pasajeros que viajan al interior del país. Su actividad es permanente durante todo el año, diariamente la realiza en la población de Colomi. Actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de insumos o materia prima para preparar el producto que vende, de esta forma incrementará sus ventas y tendrá mayores ingresos que mejoraran su nivel de vida y su situación social.
texts.en: Maria lives and works in Colomi and is economically independent.  She is hard-working and responsible and sells cooked broad beans to travelers visiting the interior part of the country.  She works all year long and every day in Colomi.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and raw materials to make the product she sells.  This is to increase sales and earn more income to improve her lifestyle and social situation.

loans.use: To buy supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Nellvi

texts.es: La señora Nellvi vive en Cochabamba provincia chapare, tiene 22 años de edad, y un nivel de instrucción de primaria, convive más de 5 años con su actual pareja, económicamente son independientes, La señora se dedica a la actividad de comercio vende diferentes productos galletas, golosinas y otros en una unidad educativa y su pareja se dedica a la actividad de chofer y también a la agricultura, siembra los cultivos de papa. La señora requiere un crédito para la compra de mercadería para su tienda ya que su ahorro lo invirtió en la compra de un terreno.  De esta forma  podrá tener  mayores ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia
texts.en: Nellvi lives in Cochabamba in the province of Chapare.  She is 22 years old and has a primary education.  For over five years she has lived with her partner and they are economically independent.  Nellvi is a merchant and sells all kinds of products such as cookies, sweets and other items at an educational center.  Her partner works as a driver and also in agriculture, growing potatoes.  The loan being requested is to buy merchandise for Nellvi's store because her savings went toward buying land.  This will give her more income and improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosio Elba

texts.es: La señora Roció tiene 38 años, es casada con el señor Wilson con el cual tiene 3 hijos dependientes que se encuentran estudiando en el nivel primario y secundario de un colegio fiscal ubicado cerca del domicilio donde viven. Actualmente su domicilio se encuentra en Cochabamba, en una casa en alquiler donde vive hace mas de dos años, estudio el nivel técnico de repostería lo que le permite colaborar con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo no alcanza a cubrirlos. Su principal ingreso proviene de la elaboración de masitas las mismas son entregadas a diferentes empresas todos los días. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un horno industrial de repostería que le permitirá tener una mayor producción y con esto tendrá mejores ingresos que serán destinados al mejoramiento del estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rocio, 38, is married to Wilson and they have three dependent children who are in primary and secondary school near their home.  She currently rents a home in Cochabamba where she has lived for over two years and studied baking at a technical level which allows her to help with the household expenses since her husband cannot cover them all.

Her main income comes from making small pastries that she delivers to companies every day.  The loan she is requesting is to buy an industrial baking oven so she can increase production and earn more income which will improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy an industrial baking oven.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: La señora Zaida vive en el municipio de Colomi Cochabamba, es soltera, se dedica a la venta en una tienda comercial, vende toda clase de productos surtidos como ser: pan, refrescos, galletas y otros a los diferentes transportistas y pasajeros que viajan por la carretera, el lugar donde vende ya es conocido para abastecerse de víveres para el viaje. Empezó con un capital mínimo y con la ayuda de sus padres logro adquirir un pequeño kiosco y más productos para la venta,  ahora ella quiere ampliar su tienda ya que está quedando pequeña y desea ofrecer más cosas, por ello solicita un crédito para comprar más productos para su tienda para que pueda generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Zaida lives in the municipality of Colomi, Cochabamba.  She is single and runs a store where she sells all kinds of products such as bread, soft drinks, cookies and other items to transportation workers and passengers who travel by road.  Her store is known as a place to buy food for travel.  She started with a minimum amount of capital and with the help of her parents she acquired a small kiosk and more products to sell.  Now she wants to expand her store because she is running out of room and wants to sell more products.  So she is requesting a loan to buy more goods for the store and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Erika Josefina

texts.es:
Erika, tiene una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad; tiene una familia compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 6 años de edad; heredo de su abuela el negocio y le ha dado continuidad, ya tiene 3 años de administrarlo, el horario de atención de la tienda es de seis de la mañana a nueve de la noche. Hasta la fecha no representa problemas en su negocio.
Con el capital comprara granos básicos, detergentes, jabón, especias, bebidas, etc.,  e incluirá productos de belleza como labiales, sombras, lociones entre otros, mejorara el inventario de su negocio para atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos con los que mejorará su situación económica.
Erika tiene como sueño continuar creciendo con su negocio, educar de la mejor manera a sus hijos y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Erika has a small store where she sells basic goods.  Her family consists of her husband and two children, ages seven and six.  She inherited the business from her grandmother and has kept it going for three years.  She opens at 6:00 a.m. and closes at 9:00 p.m.  So far she has run into no problems with the business.

She will use the loan to buy basic grains, detergents, soap, spices, drinks, etc. and also beauty products like lipstick, eye shadow, lotions, etc. to improve her store's inventory and attract more new customers.  She will increase sales and income which will improve her economic situation.

Erika dreams of expanding her business, educating her children better and paying off debt.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, detergents, soap, spices, drinks, etc. and beauty products.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La señora Sabina vive en la población de Punata en Cochabamba, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo quien está estudiando, ella es empleada y se dedica al servicio de atención en una broastería y su esposo trabaja también como empleado en el servicio de atención de ganados bovinos. La señora es de escasos recursos económicos y requiere un crédito para la compra de ganado bovino para comercializarlo y de alguna manera generar ingresos extras, la señora ademas de su trabajo como empleada también compra y vende ganados menores (ovejas), de esta forma mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sabina lives in the town of Punata in Cochabamba.  She is 46 years old, married and lives with her husband and a son who is studying.  She is an employee and works at a roast chicken restaurant.  Her husband is also employed and works with sheep.

Sabina has a low income and needs a loan to buy sheep to sell to earn extra income.  In addition to her employment she also buys and sells small livestock such as sheep.  This is to improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William, tiene  un negocio más productivo con la buena administración del préstamo anterior, con los nuevos ingresos ha cancelado su deuda e iniciado sus estudios universitarios.
Como una forma de continuar teniendo su negocio activo y bien equipado se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar discos duros, monitores, memorias, teclados, etc., con esta inversión su negocio será más competitivo y le dará ingresos para su buen desarrollo económico y académico.
texts.en:
William now has a more productive business as he put his previous loan to good use. With the new revenue, he has paid off his debt and started college. 
As a way to continue to have an active and well equipped business, he has decided to apply for a new loan to buy hard drives, monitors, memory devices, keyboards, etc., with this investment his business will become more competitive and give him good revenue for economic and academic development.

loans.use: to buy hard drives, monitors, memory devices, keyboards, etc., with this investment his business will become more competitive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es: Jose de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, es un hombre muy trabajador se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa y accesorios para el hogar, vende de forma ambulante en los pueblos aledaños, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose, 45, lives in his own house with his wife. He is a hardworking man who has sold clothing and accessories for the home for five years as a street vendor in the surrounding towns. Jose is requesting a loan to buy more ladies and men's wholesale clothing to continue with his business and so have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more ladies and men's wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Bartolome De Jesus

texts.es: Bartolomé de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo de caña de azúcar, maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Bartolomé está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 4 novillas para aumentar el ganando y asi seguir con la crianza para poder obtener mejores ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en: Bartolomé, 43, lives in his own house with his wife and their two sons. He has worked raising cattle and cultivating sugar cane, corn and beans for 10 years. With his earnings, he manages to cover his household costs. Bartolomé is requesting a loan to buy 4 heifers to increase his work and thus be able to continue working to have a better household income.

loans.use: to buy four heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing and to service his bike.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 56 years old and married with twelve children.  With three of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, canned goods, and other items.

Jesusa has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 26 years old and has four children.  She is married and two of her children are in school. Maria Theresa is a farmer in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Theresa has been a farmer for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm. In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income as a fish pond operator. Elisa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 40 years old and is a married woman. She lives in Zestaponi district. She has a school-aged son. Her husband is a state official and earns 400 GEL monthly. Manana is a private employed at a local bakery. She earns a small income and works hard to improve her family's living condition. 
In order to have her own business and increase her income, Manana plans to be involved in a trading business. She requested a loan of MFO Credo and was approved within the start-up program, a joint initiative with Kiva. The program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. So, with the loan Manana will purchase clothing stock and start peddling in her community door-to-door. It is obvious that the job is hard for Manana, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: To purchase clothing stock and start her own business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who is a fish pond operator business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and pay for laborers' salaries for her fish pond business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 7 years. Cecilia earns additional income from food vending.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: Doña marta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, ella solicita un crédito a  INTEGRAL para la compra de mas materia prima como: pollo, maíz, frijoles, carnes, verduras, etc. para poder variar el menú de comida y asi poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter. She has a stall selling food located near her house in a busy area.

She is requesting a loan from Integral to buy more raw ingredients such as: chicken, corn, beans, meat, vegetables, etc. in order to vary her food menu and thus make better income to have a better quality to life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, corn, beans, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She is a cash crop farmer in Emali town, where she grows maize, tomatoes, and vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income, and be able to educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a married woman; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 24 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Erma has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish
